choices: Go back to sleep. You don't have to get up.
Get up and join Cadence for breakfast.
Go out for your morning jog.
Walk downstairs and see about getting the paper
Go upstairs to visit the upper neighbors
1.content:
You wake up to the sound of shrieking. That must be Elle calling everyone up. Did she have to do that every morning at five? You wonder to yourself. Oh well, it's just another day. As you get up, you let out a sigh. You wonder how you as a human wound up in Horrorville, the city of monsters. From day one you've had a hard trial. Most humans would've been stomped or eaten by now but you got lucky. You found this apartment for shelter. Sure you have to share it with a giant zombie girl since you're too small to pay the rent yourself but there's always gotta be a compromise.

You remember how dangerous and chaotic this apartment could be. Lupa has nearly had you in her mouth more times than you care to remember and that fat mummy Nefernina is always threatening you with eviction or worse. When is she going to realize you're not vermin? It's really doing a number on your self esteem.

You wonder where Cadence could be. Sure you may not know what goes on in that decaying head of hers, but you like to keep track of your own three hundred foot zombie roommate.

You let out another sigh. You can't keep tabs on that girl. Well, it's the beginning of the day. What do you do?
1.title: Brave new Day

choices: It's Mavis next door singing for a recital
It's Alicia next door practicing with her guitar
It's Irene upstairs doing her morning exercise.
It's that gorgon Georgia downstairs working on a sculpture
It's Patsy outside working on her motorcycle
11.content:
You figure you can sleep in. You're unemployed since there are no jobs for humans in this city and from the looks of it Cadence has gotten up and gone to the store so you have nothing else to do. Just sleep in. That's all you can do. You let out a yawn and decide to go back to sleep.

This was perfect. If you stayed inside all day it decreases the chances of getting chewed out by Nefernina or heaven forbid, eaten by Lupa. You'd just stay here and avoid the neighbors. At least that's what you thought. You hear a loud irritating noise that wakes you up and forces you to cover your ears.

"What the heck is that racket!"
11.title: Crude Awakening

choices: You're not done talking with her, and she's angry you invaded her apartment
You simply duck under the door. No need to make a fuss of this, you're awake now
111.content:
Through your apartment walls came the echo of Mavis's wailing voice, sounding between a mix of an angry raccoon and a humpbacked whale.

"Mavis..."You mutter under your breath as you hop out of bed and quickly get dressed, leaving your apartment and walking up to her door right beside your own. You begin to furiously bang against the door to her apartment, shouting as loud as you could."Mavis! Open up! It's R.L., I've got something to say to you you overgrown bat!"From within the apartment, you heard her singing cease. After a little cluttering noise and footsteps, the door opened to see a very annoyed Mavis looking down at you, clad in nothing but a flimsy nightgown. She must've been up singing all morning.

"What is it, dahling?"She questioned."Can't you see that I'm extremely busy? I have a recital coming up, and I can't afford to waste time dawdling with the likes of you."

"Your screeching about woke up the entire building!"

"I believe it's just you, dahling. I do believe the others love my perfect voice."

"Nobody does!"

"Tcht."She rolled her eyes."Jealous, just like all the others. Now, if you'll excuse me..."She went to close the door. Just before it slammed shut, you rolled in, the wooden door banging behind you. Mavis did not know you had just done that, as she turned around, oblivious to your presence, and went back to singing.
111.title: It's Mavis next door singing for a recital

choices: Hide behind the wallpaper. How much more damage can you do at your size?
Too late, she spotted you. Run!
1113.content:
You think about complaining some more but then you let out a sigh and duck under the door and go back to the hallway. "It's not worth my time talking sense into her. You can't reason with a banshee. Especially that one." You let out a sigh. So much for sleeping in. You figure you better return back to the apartment. Good thing you only live next door.

But as you're about to reach your door, you hear a loud howling noise. "Oh don't tell me?!" There was only one creature you knew made that kind of sound and there was only one of them in the entire apartment. You turn your head to see Lupa of all people holding her ears in pain and gritting her fangs. She didn't like the sound any more than you did. "Blast that Mavis! What was Nefernina thinking allowing a banshee in the building? Doesn't she know some of us were up all night drawing out plans for the Summer swimsuit line? If she weren't already dead!!"

"Crap," you mutter. "Lupa. That's the last person I want to run into. You knew getting out of bed wouldn't be worth it. Now you're in danger of being eaten. You gotta hide fast. You could duck back into Mavis's apartment, but there's still her infernal singing and she didn't sound like she wanted to be disturbed. You then turn your head to see some loose wallpaper on the wall. You can hide behind that, but if you do any more damage to the wallpaper, Nefernina will kill you and Lupa could still pick up your scent. You wish ever day she'd catch a cold or something. You gotta think fast before Lupa sees you.
1113.title: From Bad to Worse

choices: She's quite happy, she thinks you're a fan of her music now!
She's incredibly upset at the invasion of her privacy.
11131.content:
Mavis was reasonable. You could appeal to her narcissism. But Lupa you couldn't reason with, you've tried it before. So you duck back under the door and into Mavis's apartment, her shrill voice still screeching through the air. She was singing some opera tune that you had no idea what it was. It was simply noise to you. Loud, annoying noise. But you could bear with it, through gritted teeth and held ears. She had been singing all morning. Mavis couldn't possibly keep it up forever, right?

But you were wrong, so horrible wrong. Nearly an hour and a half later, her lung power hadn't reduced at all, and you could still hear Lupa's pained whining out in the hall. What you had forgotten was that Mavis was a banshee, a creature known for their incredibly painful shrieks and lung capacity. You figured this girl could go for hours and barely be out of breathe. No wonder she was an opera singer, she probably filled the entire auditorium with her voice.

You leaned against the wall with a grimace on your face, hoping that you wouldn't be deaf by the end of the day. Her loud vocals echoed throughout the entire building, and you knew you weren't the only one suffering. Why was Nefernina allowing this?! Maybe the mummy was tone-deaf or something. Or, she liked to annoy others than just you.

And for one peaceful moment, blissful silence fell. You could hear the relieved sigh from every resident.

"Time for a quick break!"You heard Mavis say, only for her giant form to come walking towards! You looked around, and you were directly in her path towards the kitchen. You scrambled around for anywhere to hide, but it was a small apartment, and the closest furniture to hide under was blocked by the banshee woman. Before you knew it, she was standing in front of you, gazing down at you with a sense of shock.

"Umm...hi Mavis..."You waved up at her slowly.
11131.title: Take Your Chances with Mavis

choices: I ate him (a lie, but it will get Lupa out forever)
He is currently on vacation (at least you're safe for now)
111311.content:
"Well.... hey R.L., decided to come back you say." Mavis asked, noticing that you just came back to talk to her. "Fan of my music now?" Mavis asked you to be sure. In your honest head, you really do like her music, but when it's loud it's when you don't like it, and it isn't pretty in any sort of way. Right now you got a Lupa who is coming to eat you, and you needed a place to hide, and now you decide to explain the truth to Mavis.

"Okay... I will admit this right now. I really like your music, except when it's loud, and it woke me up to be honest, and I am sorry if I was rude at first." you admitted to her, and then suddenly... Mavis realizes that you complained about the noise level. Mavis sure understands quickly, and she decided to make amends. "I understand, but I wish you brought it up when you did. Sorry... let me hide you from Lupa, just in case." Mavis offered, and then you quickly accepted the offer she gave you. Lupa was now knocking on Mavis's door, and you pray that she doesn't find you, so you decide to hide behind one of the pictures she had on the table as she answers the door.

"Lupa.... get the fuck away from my apartment, or I will seriously kill you, man you are the worst neighbor I ever had!" Mavis yelled at her just when Lupa answered her. "Have you seen him?" Lupa asked.

What is Mavis's answer?
111311.title: I'll admit it!

1113111.content:
(Grand RE-300th chapter from the man behind Ryzanyes, Girlzilla, and Giantess Mecha)

Mavis then got the idea that can drive Lupa away forever. Perhaps if Mavis lied about "killing" you, which you hope it works, but you don't like that lie in your opinion, but maybe it will work, then Lupa would be drove away for good. Mavis knew a good lie to tell, because she was a sneaky gal when it comes to honesty. There were records of her cheating at her school, etc.... and she was never caught doing that at all, so this was no problem for Mavis.

"Well I just ate him, he's gone! And you better be as well, or I will make sure that this is your final day here on Monster Arms. I got human fans who like my music, and I won't let you just eat them for your own gain." Mavis said as she stood up to Lupa, and for you. Lupa was just downright shocked that Mavis told her that she took R.L. from her, and as a result, guess there is no more chasing you for good, as she was now in complete tears. Lupa was now crying like a big motherfucking baby that she is, and she was now running out of the building with her stuff. Mavis then came back to you, and you are good as she now smiles at you.

"Thank you." you replied to her. "You're welcome." Mavis added just as she prepares to get back to singing again. "If there is anything I can do to repay you, I will do it." you said to her.

Mavis replies....
1113111.title: I ate him (a lie, but it will get Lupa out fore...

11131112.content:
“There is actually no need to repay me R.L., you’re good with me, and… sorry for ruining your sleep, I will promise to keep the noise level down, okay?” she said to you, apparently apologizing for her actions of waking you up with the loud music. Well at least you were able to get away from Lupa for good, and thankfully she is gone, and as you walked out of the room, you replied. “Thanks.” You said to her, and then you walked out of the room, perhaps to find your next adventure in life.

Well, there a few options for you right now, as you need to find a job. The first job for a human opening is a movie director for a monster movie in the human world, and you actually have a talent with movies back in your days. In fact, your first job was a director for a few commercials, and you got the job for a big movie, however for some crazy reason, you had to pull back at the last minute due to family issues, and so you went away to Horrorville to settle them. It was a Cadence and her family, and while they don’t have any issues with you or Cadence, it was an important matter. Maybe you can finally go back into directing. Thankfully it’s nearby.

Another option you got is to maybe, and unbelievably, work here at Monster Arms as Nefernina’s right hand man, and maybe doing that could maybe help pay your bills to stay at the apartment. Yes you got issues with her, but what the hell.

Which one will you take?
11131112.title: Future Jobs

11132.content:
You didn't want Lupa to see you, but you couldn't bear a front row seat to Mavis's horrible singing, so you quickly run behind the loose wallpaper and grab the side to pin it to the wall to completely hide you. This however, could be more risky than being out in the open. Nefernina said that this particular wallpaper was discontinued and if you damaged it anymore than it had already been, you'd be in serious trouble. You hear Lupa whining loudly in pain from Mavis's singing. She wasn't the only one though because you heard hissing from down the hall. Izzy must've gotten a rude awakening too. It had to be the weekend for her didn't it. Even other monsters hated Mavis's singing. Well, at least the ones in the apartment.

But then you hear footsteps. Lupa is walking down the hallway with her ears plugged. But then she sniffs the air and you look out the crack in the wallpaper just a tad to see her doing so. This was not good, Lupa had a nose that could rival a bloodhound's. She memorized your scent and if she picks it up, she'll tear through the wallpaper to get you. And with your luck, Nefernina will hold you responsible for the whole thing. You hope and plead that Lupa doesn't find you.
11132.title: Wallpaper Man

choices: Someone comes up the stairs causing you both to crash
11133.content:
You didn't think fast enough and as Lupa is still writhing in pain and holding her ears, she turns her head and sees you. A fiendish smile appears on her face as she licks her lips and gets on all fours, wagging her enormous rear in the air. "Ah," she said. "A silver lining, soon to be on a silver plate." "Oh come on Lupa," you groan as that werewolf continues to walk towards you. "I just woke up." "Oh you can sleep all you want, once your in my belly you can sleep forever." It would appear being nearly deafened by a banshee didn't affect Lupa's sense of humor.

"Please Lupa. Don't I get a head start." "Sure, you have ten seconds to get ahead." "Ten seconds?!" "Time's up!" Lupa lets out a predatory growl and you're forced to run as she chases after you. This was one bad morning, first Mavis wakes you up and now Lupa's out to get you again. Some days it doesn't pay to get out of bed. This time Lupa is on your tail and snapping her jaws trying to grab you. "Help!" you yell "Help! Chel! Petra! I'd even settle for Izzy! Ah!" As you keep running, Lupa nearly takes your head off with her teeth. You've gotta get out of here fast.
11133.title: Should've Stayed in Bed

choices: You all share a hospital room
You're placed in a separate room from Lupa and Patsy
111331.content:
You run for what you think is miles but you're out of breath. "This is it," you say. "I'm dead." But when it looks like Lupa will finally catch you, you hear footsteps and hear somebody coming up the stairs. It was Patsy the cat sith somersaulting up. "Hello!" she yelled. "Anyone seen Elle? I need to borrow her headphones! That Mavis's voice could strip flesh from bone." You suddenly skid and let out a scream. You didn't know what Patsy thought of humans but considering she's a cat, you'd probably be no better off than with Lupa. You skid and hit Patsy between her toes. Patsy gives a look of confusion and raises her foot up with you holding on tight.

"Out of the way Patsy!" yelled Lupa. Lupa tries to stop herself, but she runs right into Patsy sending all three of you tumbling down the stairs. "Oh no!" you yell. You try to hold on tight to Patsy but the tumbling of two 300ft beast woman proves to much and you're tossed between both of them as you all keep falling. Lupa tries to grab you but Patsy grabs hold of her hands in an attempt to stop the tumbling. At one point you get bounced off Lupa's giant belly and into Patsy's eye, causing her to hiss. "This won't end well." You say. It doesn't take long for you three to make it downstairs the hard way.

Meanwhile, Chel, the yeti girl nurse from downstairs had put on her nurse outfit and was walking out to go to work with a smile on her face, showing her huge fangs. Of course, her smile quickly turned the other way when she heard a tumbling noise followed by a loud crash on the ground. Chel walks out to investigate and finds you three on the ground. Lupa got off the most easily, all she had was one broken leg. Patsy wasn't so lucky and both her legs were fractured. You on the other hand had two broken arms and injured knees. You groan in pain as do the two monster girls laying on top of your left arm. Chel lets out a sigh. "I've heard of bringing your work home, but not the other way around." If being woken by Mavis and chased by Lupa wasn't bad enough, now you were going to the hospital.
111331.title: Crash Course

choices: Lupa gets up to try and eat you again
Cadence visits you in the hospital
1113311.content:
"Dr. Howard! Dr. Fine! Dr. Howard!"

The three of you were placed in the same room in the Horrorville hospital. You were placed in a bed near the door that was much too big for your size and you have your arms in casts and your knees in braces. Patsy is in a bed near the window with both her legs in casts and a sour look on her face. She hisses at Lupa who is in the center of the room with her own leg in a cast. Lupa glares at Patsy back.

"This is all your fault puddy tat! You cost me my breakfast." "Do you really need it wolfsbane breath? I'll bet other werewolves don't need a full moon. Your ass will do fine." Lupa growls at Patsy as Patsy meows angrily. You let out a laugh. It would make sense for them to hate each other with the whole feline canine thing going on.

As your two monstrous roommates are fighting, Chel walks in the room in her nurse's outfit. "How are we all feeling today?" You let out a groan and Chel inspects your wounds. "Poor R.L. You got the worst of it." Chel even hisses as she looks at how much pain you'd have to be in. She even puts an ice pack on your knee. "Thanks Chel." You liked Chel. She was one of the few monsters in the apartment building who wasn't hostile towards humans. She was kind of like a second Cadence. The best part was that she was the second tallest monster in the whole building after Petra, that ginormous gargoyle from the top floor.

Chel then walked up to Lupa who was growling in pain and she didn't have half the sympathy towards you for that flea bitten man eater. "It serves you right for always chasing poor R.L. around like prey. Why must you eat every human you see? I think I remember one human actually saved you from a trap when you were a pup and you ate her anyway. That appetite of yours is getting out of hand." Lupa lets out a scoff. "Easy for you to say Chel. You're a yeti. You don't eat meat." Chel gives Lupa her medicine and then walks up to Patsy.

While Chel is tending to the neko girl, Lupa turns her attention to you and you sweat as she moves her finger under her neck. "Give me a break." You thought. "Even when she's in traction, she still wants to eat me?" Patsy sticks out her tongue and turns her head the other way. "I hate pills," she says. "Stupid wolf. I was going out riding with the Firecats today." "Those fashion faux pas?" asks Lupa with a scoff. "Even I couldn't make those jackets look good and I design clothes for a living." Patsy hisses again. "You wanna start something Lupa!" "Go ahead and try Patsy! I'll wipe out seven of your eight lives!"

"Eight lives?" asks Chel. "I thought Cat siths had nine lives." "It's a long story." Says Patsy with a sigh. You let out a sigh yourself. "Why did I get stuck with them?" After Chel has given you all your medicine, she decides to leave. "If anybody needs me, just press the button by your bed." She says. With that she's gone. After Chel leaves, you hear a growling noise and turn your head. Lupa is still glaring at you and then you realize that Chel left crutches by her bed. "Oh great Chel," you mutter. "Real smart. Leaving her crutches. Weren't you supposed to give those to Patsy." What were you saying? Patsy was a cat and she probably was just as dangerous to humans as Lupa.

You let out a groan and hope for the best.

Patsy lets out a hiss at Lupa. "Didn't Chel just chew you out for trying to eat him earlier? I'm telling." Lupa turns around and walks up to Patsy before whacking Patsy in the leg with her crutches and making her meow in pain "They'll be plenty more of that if you get between me and my breakfast whiskers."

How ironic. You remember a cartoon like this many years ago, except this time you were the Tweety, Lupa was the Sylvester and Patsy was the bulldog. "This time you're not getting away."

Will Lupa finally succeed in eating you?

What does Lupa do next?

Who is it?

So that's how she tolerated Mavis's infernal singing. Mavis's singing was making your skull crack and you had to hold it together. You really hope Nefernina doesn't see you.

She says as she gives an evil smile. You tremble and your bones shake.

What does Nefernina have in store for you?
111332112.title: Insult to Injury

choices: They all begin messing with you now
1152211.content:
Patsy decides to lock you into her cage and then she takes you out to meet the Firecats. The Firecats all share the same room as they live with each other, and since they are awesome at their gang job, they are never captured by Petra or the monster police in Horrorville (or even the Terrordale if we do a crossover on this one). They were some Firecats, and some are more vicious than others. There is the 18 year old wild cat (Aegean cat) Kari, a (American Polydactyl) cat name Nomad, and lastly there is the young (13 years old member and is a (Japanese Bobtail) girl name Kona.

They were all wearing their gang clothes when they see her coming inside with you, and you knew that it isn't going to be good as you are their prey, and they are the predators. "Girls... looks like I caught us a human!" Patsy said, as she comes in and reveals you to the group. "Wow... an actual human being... I sure want to have him." Kona smiled. "No way... he's mine!" Nomad grittered.

What happens now?
1152211.title: Takes you to meet the Firecats

1152212.content:
"On second thought I think you can just be my breakfast," Patsy says with a grin.

You scream in terror as she then drops you into her right onto her tongue. Patsy then closes her move sealing you in darkness. You quickly become covered from head to toe as Patsy's giant rough tongue starts licking you against the roof of her mouth and roll you around on her tongue. You realize that she's enjoying your taste when you hear her starting to purr. However, as she continues to play with you with her rough tongue you pray that Patsy will swallow you soon so you don't have to endure this torment any more. Patsy continues to savor your delicious flavor for a few moments longer though. You scream in terror, and somewhat filled with relief, when Patsy's tongue finally settles down and starts pushing you towards the back of the throat. Then Patsy tilts her head back and swallows you whole.

You slowly travel down the esophagus. You become covered in mucus and even more saliva as the muscles massage you down. Your journey comes to an end as you suddenly hit the stomach sphicter. It recognizes you as food and opens up allowing you to land in the stomach a splash. The digestive jucies imeadeately begin to go to work on you. You cry out in pain as you're slowly digested alive.
1152212.title: Eats You

choices: Someone hears the fighting and goes to investigate
115222.content:
You run and think you can escape from Patsy by going around the corner. But then you let out a scream and skid because Lupa comes around the corner. But before either monster could catch you, Patsy skids and crashes right into Lupa, knocking her down. While both monsters are distracted, you run to a safe spot behind a table leg.

Then you decide to look and watch the fun as Patsy and Lupa get up. Lupa growls at Patsy. "What's the big idea Patsy!" "What's your big idea dogface!" yells Patsy. "You cost me my breakfast." Lupa lets out a look of surprise and then realizes something and gets mad. "Breakfast?" she asks. "You wouldn't be talking about my little snack would you?" Patsy nods her head. "You bitch!" yells Lupa. "I can't believe you! I have dibs on R.L."

"Shut up furball! Your snack called me a disgusting whore beast and showed photographs that made it look like I had a you no what. He needs to be punished." "You're going to eat him out of spite? That's not how it works. At least let him be the prey of somebody who will savor him. You're stealing my meal." "Well Lupa," says Patsy. "Something tells me you won't starve. You're not a werewolf, you're a whalewolf!" "I have big bones!" "Yeah," replies Patsy. "All of them are in your butt."

Lupa growls as Patsy gives an angry meow. You let out a laugh even though they both want to eat you. But then again, Those two hated each other's guts and a fight was about to break out. "You do have hair like an old granny," says Lupa. "And you also have poor taste in fashion. I mean, black leather with red flames. It's been done to death." "Well at least my mom doesn't eat her own vomit." That was the last straw for Lupa and she growls louder than before. "Let's see how many lives you do have!" yells Lupa.

Lupa roars and Patsy hisses as they both attack each other. Patsy scratches Lupa in the face before Lupa bites her on the tail. Patsy then kicks Lupa in the stomach before Lupa slams her butt in Patsy's face and pins her to the ground. But Patsy pulls on Lupa's lovehandles and makes her scream. Patsy the tries to strangle Lupa with her legs. Then Lupa bit her again.

You know that the best idea would be to run, but for some reason, you couldn't resist a good catfight (with an actual cat and wolf).
115222.title: Like Cats and Dogs

choices: She has an unpleasant surprise cooked up for you
12.content:
You smell something good cooking and immediately get down and walk towards the kitchen. "Cadence must already be cooking breakfast." You say to yourself. You keep walking to see Cadence was indeed cooking and from the looks of it she still hadn't gotten dressed yet since she was only wearing her undergarments. She let out a moan as she continued to cook.

You couldn't understand a word Cadence said and that made it hard for you to approach her. At least she was hospitable enough to keep you alive. Maybe it was because she was once human herself, but somehow when she rose from her grave she ballooned up to three hundred feet tall. You've been meaning to ask who she was when she was alive.

Whatever she was cooking sure smelt good. For a giant rotted corpse she was a good cook. You wonder what she has planned for breakfast today.
12.title: Breakfast is Served

choices: She's having writer's block for a horror novel she's writing
She's expecting a visit from her mother
There's a new "anti-undead" neighbor across the way
121.content:
You climb up the kitchen table and see that Cadence was cooking pancakes. "Good morning Cadence." You called up to your roommate. However, Cadence didn't respond, not that you expected her to say anything but you were surprised she didn't pay attention. You then smelt the air and realized that Cadence wasn't paying attention to what she was doing either.

"Cadence! Snap out of it!" Cadence quickly realized she was burning breakfast and let out a grunt before flipping away the pancake, nearly hitting you with it. "Hey! Careful!" Cadence then tried to get a replacement batter, but nearly tripped on the pancake she dropped and wound up knocking her eye out onto the table next to you. Cadence lets out a moan and places her eye back in before getting back to what she was doing.

You realize that something must be wrong with Cadence. She was shaking and you certainly don't recall her being so klutzy. Cadence joined you at the table and gave you a piece of one of her pancakes, but you can't eat knowing Cadence was trouble. She wasn't even eating her breakfast. Instead she was picking at it with her fork nervously.

"Cadence? Is something bothering you?" Cadence let out a groan and a few mutters. You let out a sigh. "Cadence, I can't understand a word you say." Cadence then let out a groan and then picked up a pen and a piece of paper. She couldn't speak so she'd write out what was bothering her.
121.title: The Shaking Dead

choices: She's angry that Cadence used her in the story
It's you she wants to talk to
1211.content:
"You don't know how to continue your new novel?" Cadence nods. You suddenly have an idea. "Well, I took a some creative writing classes in high school, maybe I can help. A look of joyous relief graces Cadence's face as she sighs and lets out a grunt of thanks. "It's no problem. After all you've done for me, this is the least I can do."


After you eat breakfast, Cadence picks you up and places you front of her computermwith her in progress novel opened on screen. You quickly skim through th3 story and see it was a story of a werewolf, cursed to transform into a human at sunset every day. An idea begins to form in your mind. "You know what would be funny?" You say "If the werewolf was Lupa. I'd like to see her being shown how it feels to be at the bottom of the food chain."



Cadence actually finds this notion amusing, and makes a few edits to the story so Lupa is the main character. For the next few hours, you dictated your ideas to Cadence while she typed away. Since this was supposed to be a horror novel, you decided to have it end with Lupa being eaten, as she had done to countless humans. You smiled to yourself as Cadence typed the final sentence. "Well, I quite enjoyed that. Maybe for your next book, we can make it about Nefernina." Cadence presses print as the two of you share a laugh.



A few weeks later, Cadence'new book is published. There's a knock at the door, and Cadence answers it, only to find Lupa standing there with a copy of her new book. What does Lupa want?
1211.title: Writer's Block

12112.content:
"Hey Cadence, Can I talk to you and R.L.?" Lupa asks straight away without waiting for a 'hello' back, or an 'Uhhh' in Cadence's circumstance. She then held up a copy of the new book and Cadence understood then went to fetch R.L.
Nothing bad would happen along as she was there.

You're sitting on the kitchen table when Cadence comes through with a worried look on her face. Your stomach immediately drops as though you've just hit the descent on a roller coaster and for good reason. There's only two instances that immediately spring to mind when Cadence makes that expression; When there's 'Anti Dead' supporters around or when you're in danger, which probably means Lupa or Nefernina are here to give you a cardio workout.

"Our Landlady is at the door I presume?" you ask with an expectant expression and slowly increasing heart rate.

Cadence starts switching between gesturing to her teeth and stomach. "Lupa." you sigh. Cadence nods, then lays her hand out. "Let's just get this over with" you say as you climb on and settle your self in her great blue palm.

As she walks through you notice her fingers are arched and look as though they're about to just close over you. You have to admire how protective Cadence gets around you. Why can't Lupa just be like her?

You both arrive at the door and Lupa is still there waiting, you make eye contact with her and before you can look away she blurts out "Hey R.L.". This instantly struck you the wrong way as she usually refers to you as 'snack' or 'breakfast', you know those totally normal terms of endearment.

"So what's it going to be today? you gonna wrestle Cadence to get me? Or are you trying to pull a quick one? Why do you have that?" you point to the book. "Woah! Slow down! I just wanted to come and say thank you. It's so cool you used me as the main character! Cadence gave you credit in the acknowledgments. I never thought you'd do anything like that for me".

"I would nev!- wait..." - "You gave me a writing credit?" you say surprised turning to Cadence for a moment. She looks down at you with a faint smile and gently brushes the side of your face with her tremendous index finger and mumbles something unintelligible that sounded vaguely like 'Course I did'.

Your sharply drawn back to Lupa when she starts to speak again. "I'm so glad you actually like me enough to do that! I've been trying to get your attention ever since you moved in!".

Enough of this nonsense you think. You have no time for her games anymore. "I will NEVER like you Lupa! You're ferocious and self centred! And Trust me you definitely have my undivided attention, considering if I take it away from you whenever you're close by, I'll probably end up in that fat gut of yours!". Almost as if in defence, Lupa's left paw instinctively went to rest upon her titanic belly and she looked at you in the same way she did when Cadence first saved you from her. It takes a moment for her to respond.

"We've had a few close calls but I thought we were just playing?" she eventually answered. "PLAYING!?" You bark at her. "I've never known someone so cruel, greedy and gluttonous! I mean just look at the size of yo-" you stop when she suddenly runs off, appearing to be crying before she dodges out of sight.

You turn to Cadence in a manner of confusion and depleting exasperation. "What just happened?" you say scratching the back of your head. Cadence looked at where Lupa had run off before tilting her head back down at you and proceeded to groan and mumble broken sentences. You manage to catch the drift of what she's saying. She thinks you should go and talk to Lupa alone and try to patch things up. "Yeah that'll be the day, 'Me wandering around Lupa's apartment alone with no back up', This could just be another scheme to eat me!".

She grunts something back quickly that was clearly meant to mean 'And if not?'.

"Then...then..." you stutter trying to think of some devious way she is trying to deceive you when it, all of a sudden, hits you like lightning. "Then I just hurt someone really badly that only wanted to be my friend and didn't know how to go about it".

Cadence nods her head in the direction of Lupa's apartment in a 'Do you want to go?' fashion.

If there was ever a time to end all the hassle that you have with Lupa, it was now. But Cadence really outdone herself in those last ten minutes. She really deserves a treat.
12112.title: Blueprints of the future.

choices: Ask if she would be able regurgitate you.
121121.content:
You arrive at Lupa's apartment in Cadence's hand and she kneels down to set you on the floor near the door. She mimicked something to you that was her own way of asking if you wanted her to go with you. "Don't worry Cadence, I've had a lot of experience dealing with Lupa and the obvious advantage she has over me" you chuckle, semi-confidently. Cadence Laughs and leaves to wait nearby and listen for any commotion.

You turn to face the door. Lips pressed together into a blank expression, you straighten your jacket and psyche yourself up as you proceed to knock.

A towering Lupa answers the door very slowly. You can see she's still been crying and she was wiping her eyes as she opened the door. "Down here Lupa!" you yell, bracing your legs incase you need to run and let the 'Karate Cadence' do her thing. "R.L.! what are you doing here?" she queries sobbingly. "I'm here to talk. I don't understand some of the things you said back there. I'd like to hear you out before I make my mind up about you". you reply back as dignified as you can sound. After all, if this little facade turns out to be true then you've just insulted someone who might potentially end up being your friend.

"You can come in if you want?" she said trying her hardest to wrinkle out a smile through her 'Post-cry' face. "Uh, um yeah sure" you accept still weary. She bends down and offers out her hand. This was it, moment of truth. You quickly sneaked a glance over to see if Cadence was still there whilst climbing up. She smiled as if to say 'I'm right here if you need me', which was reassuring to the lingering doubt in your head.

Lupa lifts you up, smiles right at you and retreats inside with you in-hand. She sets you down on a table and sits down on the couch in front of you. You look around casually for a moment, briefly taking in your surroundings. Then you turn to Lupa. "The stage is yours. Convince me you're not evil". you demand with calm conviction. "Stop calling me evil!" she starts to sob up again but this time more argumentative. "I would never have eaten you for real!" she proclaims. "You're lying through your teeth Lupa! I've literally been seconds away from being in there!" pointing to her stomach. "You have to explain that!" you exclaim, justifiably exasperated. "I was just trying to get you to like me! I swear! I kept noticing how close you were getting with Candace and I thought you might find it attractive if I started acting a bit unpredictable and I got a bit out of hand" she tries to explain staring at the ground. She almost looked embarrassed.

"That doesn't really cut it Lupa. What about all the people you've boasted about eating? what about them! Was that part of 'the show' too?!" you fire at her. She glances up at you for a few seconds and sighs as she lowers her head again. "I want to be honest with you R.L. Yes I have and still do eat humans. But you never stopped to think about who I was eating. Some of those people were horrible human beings. Humans who had wronged me in some way. Yes a few of the reasons I ate them were petty, but some of them wanted to be eaten, if you can believe that" she dressed in a subtle pleading tone.

"No, I can't believe that. That is total horse! What human beings wanted to be eaten alive? Give me some context here" you call over folded arms.

Lupa takes a breath, lifts her head and holds eye contact with you for a few seconds before she speaks again.

"There were people who were close to death that just wanted to pass away somewhere quiet and peaceful. They saved a fortune in funeral costs, and they even had the service on top of my stomach. There were others who just wanted to be swallowed whole because they were in love with the thought of being inside my big belly, some of them were even young male and female humans. They would always ask to lie on my stomach and listen to my gut gurgle before they went in. I even managed to regurgitate a few of the ones who wanted to go in for a while then come out, so even if I did accidentally swallow you, I probably would've been able to get you out" she said with a wink and a few pats on her stomach but still remaining respectfully quiet.

You run your right hand through your hair and stare off while you try to regain your breathing. You're beginning to have thoughts you never thought you would. You look back and link eyes again, "You have to understand this is difficult to believe but I don't think it's impossible. Someone was that willing to give up their life to spend whatever amount of time they did. Digesting inside you?!".

Lupa nodded and took a breath in. "That's right, for some reason or another they all wanted to end up inside here" she shakes the dormant, gargantuan pot belly with her left paw which leaves it jiggling as she prepares to speak again. "I caught you glancing at it when you first came here. That's why I thought you would like that stuff" she says on an exhale.

You look up at the colossal bulk of fat that is, Lupa's stomach and muster up the ability to speak again. "I mean its big, really big! Compared to a human being anyway. I have to admit, it has always looked good on you whenever I've seen it from afar. I can see why people might like lying on it. I mean I guess it looks comfortable" you piece together in a slightly steady tone.

Lupa's eyes gently widened a little. She looks down at her bulging gut to take a hold of it then begins to rub it while she lifts her eyes back up to look at you. "Do you want to come and listen to it? Maybe have a nap together?" she says with a quick upward nod and a winsome smile.

You subtly gasp for the tiniest flow of air and look to the ground for no less than a moment before relaxing your shoulders and regaining your dwindling stance on all that makes sense.

"I can't do that Lupa. How could I possibly lay there without thinking about how many of my kind have lost their lives to form this?" you repel. "Well R.L. All I can say is I'm a monster and I do what monsters do. Maybe you could adjust to that the same way you've adjusted to the way Cadence smells. I can't imagine that was very fun for you when you first moved in. Now you ride around on her shoulder without a care in the world". she earnestly replies.

"I won't ever eat you unless you ask me to small fry" she adds with a chuckle after a pause.

You just breath and nod, taking it all in. you look up when she starts to speak again after a minute or two. "So you wanna nap on here?" she beckons to her towering plump soft belly.
121121.title: Go to Lupa's Apartment.

choices: Ask if you can spend a bit more time with her outside of her stomach.
Ask her to let you out so you can go find Cadence.
1211212.content:
"Actually Lupa...I um...I have a question to ask" you say just managing to stay sounding calm. "Uh yeah sure, shoot I guess" she defeatedly but cheerily replies.

You steal a quick glance of her rotund middle and stare at the ground again. "Well I was just pondering something you said and it got me thinking" you chirp casually. "We spoke about a few things 'R', you're gonna need to narrow it down" she responds, matching your tone.

Ripping the band-aid off swiftly you decide to just blurt it out.

"Lupa. Would you be able to regurgitate me if I let you swallow me?" you say exhausted behind closed eyes. You hear a small gasp and a loud rumble. When you open your eyes you immediately realise that Lupa has moved a bit closer to you. You lift your eyes up to meet hers. She's staring back at you in what looks like shock and disbelief. "Do you really mean that?" she whimpers.

"Only if I know I'll get to come back out again" you say failing to blink now. "Well I haven't had a lot to eat today so it'll probably be easier to find you and push you back up so I can start hacking you back out" she informs you happily. "But doesn't that mean when I go in, I'll get digested quicker?" you quickly counter.

"Hey, don't worry. I'll just drink lots of Minotaur milk after I gulp you down and then the acids in my gut will water down a bit. You'll be safe with me R.L. I promise" she says gesturing to her podgy mass.

You start walking towards Lupa. You can tell she knows why as she's already laying her hand out for you to climb on. She lifts you into the air as she stands up. You can see that Her belly truly is gigantic from this angle. It's just so plump and inviting. You never thought you would be trying to get 'into' Lupa Howler's stomach. But here you are clenched in her titanic paw, eager to arrive.

"In the spirit of telling you the truth R.L. I am really going to enjoy this" she grins endearingly. "So am I Lupa" you respond simply. Her grin then relaxes into a sweet smile.

She begins to lift you when her expression changes. "Hang on, there's something coming" she quickly follows her statement by holding you tight against her fur coated monumental pot gut. There was just enough pudge to let you sink in a bit. As blissful as it was you wondered what the reason for it was. Then as if to answer you heard a small rumble come from deep within Lupa. All of a sudden her belly started to inflate against you as she let out a mighty thunderous belch. As her stomach bloated more she increased the pressure with which she was pinning you to her. The belch ended and Lupa's stomach returned to where it was before. As everything was shifting back into shape inside she still held you close against her behemoth mid section so you could listen to the gurgling explosions and hungry rumbles.

She then brings you up to her face. "Hear all that? Your going to be fixing that for a while small fry!" she said whilst licking her lips. "You ready to go down?" she asked eagerly.

You nod. You are utterly speechless.

She lifts you up a bit higher and tilts hers head back. She opens her maw with an audible groan. Her tongue extends a bit to accept you when she lets go and you stat plummeting towards her mouth. Instantly Lupa starts to roll you everywhere. Against her gums, on the roof of her mouth and under the tongue. She was really savouring you and enjoying it by the sounds of the noises she was making.

"Alright R.L. I think it's time we get better acquainted". With one loud gulp she sends you down her gullet. You squeeze through her with moist ease. Then you land into her warm, waiting, cavernous gut.

Not long after the Minotaur milk Lupa promised arrived, in waves. To mix it up with her acids, she began to shake her belly around. You got sloshed around fantastically and hit off the pink walls of her stomach just to glide back down and rejoin the waves. After a while Lupa stopped and her gut jiggling. You settle nicely into the acid/Minotaur milk bath and just lay against the stomach walls.

Lupa sat back on the couch with her hands on her content belly and her mind on the little passenger inside.

You wonder to yourself if Cadence might still be waiting for you when you get out.

The soothing gurgles and soft rumbles send you to sleep. Lupa sits watching television whilst gently rubbing her stomach within where her new friend now lays fast asleep.

_________________

What do you do when Lupa wakes you up an hour later?
1211212.title: Visiting the Graveyard.

12113.content:
Lupa gives a slight growl. "Where is R.L.?" asks the giant man eating werewolf. "I need to speak to him." You at the time are on Cadence's shoulder but you don't trust the wolf. "No way," you say. "You'll just eat me." Lupa let out a growl. "I insist." She said. Cadence holds out her hand and you slide down her decayed arm before looking up at Lupa who looks more than a little mad. "Human by Night," said Lupa reading the title of the book. "Best seller. Of course, why am I the werewolf in this book?! You put Cadence up to this you crumb!" "Well it serves you right," you say. "You're the one who's always trying to nom me."

Lupa gives a growl but then she smiles smugly. "Speaking of which, I'm changing tactics." You blinked in confusion. "What was that?" you ask. Lupa then takes out what looks like a deck of cards. "I've been watching Shocker Tales. Ever heard of an episode called Dead Man's Hand?" You give a gulp. "That's the episode where a man plays cards with the grim reaper right?" Lupa nodded her head. "That's right. And just like in that episode, I've got a deal for you. We'll play a game of chance. Well, chance for you." Cadence blinks and bites her lip. "Here are the stakes," said Lupa. "You win, I don't try to eat you for a year. I don't think I need to tell you what happens should you lose." Lupa licks her fangs and you gulp at the werewolf.

"So, R.L.? Do you accept my challenge." Cadence moans and shakes her head to try and get you out of this and dissuade you from accepting Lupa's challenge, but you begin to think. Perhaps this isn't such a bad idea after all. If you literally play your cards right, Lupa will leave you alone. Of course, Lupa might cheat. But maybe you should.

"Tick, tock, tick, tock," says Lupa. "Do you accept, my little snack?"
12113.title: Dead Man's Hand

1212.content:
Cadence wrote out her problem and then you read her giant handwriting. "Your mother is coming for a visit." Cadence lets out a grunt and nods her head. "What's the big deal? My family can't visit me in this monster town. It's too dangerous." Cadence just let out a few moans and you could tell that she had a few issues. And then she pointed to you. Your eyes popped. "You didn't tell her about me." Cadence shook her head and then grunted again. You could tell she wasn't sure what her mother would think about you. "Oh come on, I'm sure we'll get along great." Cadence let out a moan to say she was unsure and then picked you up.

Soon, the two of you had entered the lobby and were waiting for Cadence's mother to show up. Cadence was so nervous that she was biting her fingers off. You've seen her do this before and you thank your lucky stars that they can be reattached. But you're wondering. Cadence is a zombie, so that should mean her mom would be a zombie, but Cadence looks as if she died young from her physical appearance. As you're trying to think the matter over, you see that gorgon Georgia walking towards you both and you cover your eyes in case Georgia forgot to wear her glasses again. Last time that happened, Nefernina had to explain a missing person's report to the pizza place and dispose of a statue discreetly.

"Head's up Cadence," said Georgia. "Your mother's here." This is the big moment, you're about to meet Cadence's mom.
1212.title: She's expecting a visit from her mother

choices: "She's still my daughter, I still love her."
12122.content:
Into the lobby came a small, petite, frail-looking woman, but a stern expression on her face. She trotted up to Cadence towing a pull-along traveling bag behind her, walking right up to the zombie girl's feet."Cadence, it's so good to see you again!"She piped up. Cadence replied with a moan that sounded like Hi mom. The giant undead knelt down and placed you on the floor, looking at her human mother with a mixture of happiness and and uncertainty.

"C'mon, give momma a hug..."Cadence's mother said, completely ignoring you. Cadence gently picked her up and hugged her to her face like she was a small doll. After the touching ordeal was done, Cadence placed her down beside you and picked up the bag with her index finger and thumb.Follow me. She seemed to grunt out again, stood up, and took slow strides, allowing you and her mother, much smaller, to follow behind easily.

"Hey. I'm R.L., Cadence's roommate."You say after a long silence. She haughtily looked over at you.

"I'm Heidi."She replied, giving you a once over with a stern gaze."Ah yes...The man with the initials for a name. My daughter's spoken much about you in her letters."She replied. You perked up at that."She says you're always getting into trouble around here, and very few of the neighbors like you."

Your shoulders sagged a tad.

The two of you followed behind the giant zombie for some time, the awkward silence heavy amongst you."So uhh..."You began again."How long has uh...Cadence been a zombie?"You ask. You had asked Cadence beforehand, but when she replied, you barely understood her at all. Maybe you could get a straight answer from somebody who could speak properly?

"Please refrain from using the 'Z' word please..."She cringed a little."I believe Cadence prefers to be called 'Undead' or even 'Living Challenged."

You've never heard that from Cadence herself. Have you been hurting her feelings all this time you've been calling her a zombie? That left a bad feeling in your stomach.

"Anyways..."Heidi interrupted."To answer your question, Cadence...ceased breathing when she was very young, around her early twenties, that was nearly fifteen years ago. The very next day after her funeral, we have a 300ft. version of my deceased daughter walking around, trying to communicate with groans and moans."

"S...you're cool with your daughter being a zom-....uh...Undead?"You caught yourself. Heidi looked up at her daughter before looking back at you with her reply.
12122.title: She's human, your size

121222.content:
"Well, these things happen," she said with a shrug.

"They-they do?" You replied, surprised at her taking it so well.

"She's still my daughter and I love her dearly," she said with a nod. "We live in a strange world. One day you're little girl's waving pom poms at her college homecoming game, the next she's 300 foot tall and is falling apart. We all must try to get by." Last time you had one of those bike parties, I had the cops here to see if I was hosting an illegal event! I had to let Petra move in for free to keep an eye on things to make sure the police didn't shut down the apartment!"

Sheesh...just how bad was it if Patsy's motorbike friends stopped by? Wait...seeing as you had that incident with Patsy trying to eat you earlier, you didn't want to know...not as long as you were part-bird, anyways.

Snatching you and setting you on her desk, Nefernina waved her hands over you and muttered an incantation. When she stopped, you were still a small bluebird harpy with feathered wings for arms and hands, talons for feet, but now you had your human face as opposed to a beaked one, and you lacked breasts, and your crotch area was back to being a male's.

"There. Made him a guy again. Even kept him a Harpy so Lupa leaves him alone now too." the landlord told the biker, then turned away. "...And I thought it was BLACK cats that were supposed to be bad luck..." the mummy grumbled, to which Patsy just smirked at that.

Well, good news: you were a guy again. Bad news: you were still a bluebird harpy. Still, Lupa leaving you alone was an added bonus. Final score is Catgirl: 1, Mummy: 0...Go Patsy.

Nefernina muttered something else in Egyptian and you fell on your butt as the surface under your talons raised a bit, causing a concentrated earthquake for you as several rods rose up around you with a creaking, groaning sound, all of them bending inwards and joining together at the top. Your eyes widened at what Nefernina had conjured. This was...!

"A bird cage?!" Patsy said, then broke out into a fit of giggles.

"From now on, R.L.'s YOUR problem, Patsy. You're keeping him if doing this was so damn important to you. Hope you choke ten times over on your new bird-brained roommate!" Nefernina snaps, holding out the cage to her.

The giant Siamese cat sith girl hissed, her fur standing on end, even as your cage exchanged hands "I'd never eat R.L.! NEVER! Even if he would taste like chicken now!"

"Hey!" you shouted.

"...Sorry." Patsy said to you, embarrassed at what she'd just said. Then she perked up. "Well come on, my little birdie-boy! We're gonna have lots of fun now that you're mine!" She walked out of Nefernina's office carrying the cage you were in.

"Hey Patsy....How did you know who I was?" you asked as you were carried through the halls, that had been bugging you, weren't gonna complain about it since it saved you from being eaten, but you were curious.

Patsy laughed "You sure you don't have some Dodo bird in your new body? How did I know...are you kidding? Who ELSE hates the Poodle-slut as much as I do? It was the way you described Lupa that tipped me off!"

You roll your eyes and smile haplessly. Figures. Cats and dogs...

You both arrived at patsy's first-floor apartment and she sets you and your cage next to a stack of magazines about different types of motorcycles on a coffee table.

"Wait here, my birdie. I'll be back with Cadence and we'll explain everything to her. Don't worry R.L., I'll take care of you." She said, then left, shutting the door behind her.

You sigh, feeling restless and bored already. There was nothing to do but pace your cage. You wanted out! Sheesh...no wonder caged birds always wanted to get loose and fly free in the sky.

After a few minutes the door to Patsy's apartment opened and you looked up to see who entered.

It was...
