choices: She takes you to her room.
124312.content:
"Sorry, but I'll have to keep you with me." she says as she holds you in her palm. You look at her in confusion. "What are you talking about?" you ask slightly worried. "I'm going to be taking care of you while I'm here!" she announces. "You humans are soo cute! You in particular are especially cute if I may say." This makes you slightly embarrassed, but you quickly remember your situation.

"I'm a grown man, I can take care of myself." you tell her. "And besides I live with Cadence, so she looks out for me." Cadence grunts in agreement. Bambi brings you up to her eye. "But I love humans! I'll take good care of you, so you don't have to worry at all!" You don't really like this. She's talking like you're going to be her new pet. Sure, she might be nice, but it is a little demeaning.

Cadence then steps in and tries to speak up. "Uuhhg." Well, not really speaking, but she tries to help you. Bambi responds but putting her foot down. "Now listen here, I'm keeping you with me and thats that. It'll only be until Nefernina gets back, so just accept it." she says firmly but nicely, as if still talking to a pet. She makes her way into the building. What happens now?
124312.title: I sadly have to, you will be a pet to me for aw...

1243121.content:
Bambi carries you into the building, all the while you're trying to dissuade her. "Please, don't do this. I'm not a pet. I've been living here this long without someone taking care of me." you desperately plead. Bambi looks down and responds. "Well then consider this as a vacation. I'll take care of everything you need, so don't worry." This is getting you nowhere. Anything you say goes in one ear and out the other with her.

She carries you to the room she's staying in and deposits you on her bed. "I'll be right back." she tells you. "I just need to go get my luggage, so sit tight cutie." You know she's being nice, but you need to get out of here. As soon as she leaves you begin to climb down the blanket and land on the floor. You make your way to the door as fast as you can. Unfortunately, the door swings open before you reach your goal.

Bambi walks into the room holding her bags, her enormous hoof almost flattening you as she heads over to the bed.When she sees you're not where she left you she frantically searches the floor. "R.L., where are you? Come here before you get hurt!" she says in a worried tone. You continue to the door, hoping she doesn't spot you. Your hopes are unfounded though. You are in plain view on the floor after all. She quickly snatches you up and carries you back to the bed. "Why were you down there? Its dangerous! I could have stepped on you!" You refrain from telling her that she almost did. "Well don't worry, I know how to prevent this from happening again!" She opens one of her suitcases and brings out a....
1243121.title: She takes you to her room.

12431212.content:
She reaches into her bag and produces a small cage. Well, small to her. For you it would probably be pretty roomy. You don't want to find out though, so you immediately take off. Of course it futile though. Bambi just reaches over and picks you up before you get very far. She brings you to her face and gives you a stern look

."See? This is why I need the cage. You don't know how to keep still." she tells you as if she's talking to a child. "I know how to stay still." you say. Your voices gradually gets louder. "I just shouldn't have to because I'm a grown adult!" She just wags her huge finger in your face. "I'm not saying your not an adult, but you are a human. Its too dangerous for someone like you in a place like this." You then let out a frustrated yell. This is like talking to a brick wall.

You then decide you have nothing left to lose and begin flailing angrily as she holds you between her fingers. You actually manage to slip loose, but you end up plummeting down her shirt. You land in between her breasts and begin to struggle. Shortly after her fingers reappear and grab you once again. "Oooh! You naughty little guy! I think thats enough mischief for today." With that she deposits you in the cage and bends her face down to your level. "Now behave." What next?
12431212.title: She Just Won't Listen

choices: Other monsters get involved in the argument
12433.content:
“TO MY FREAKING OPINION, YOU ARE JUST AN ABSOLUTE DISGRACE THAT YOU ARE LIVING HERE. WHILE I AM HERE, ALL HUMANS MUST MOVE OUT OF THE APARTMENTS IMMEDIATELY, IF YOU ARE LIVING WITH A MONSTER, YOU ARE IMMEDIATELY EVICTED AS WELL!!!! I DON’T GIVE A SHIT IF YOU HAVE PAID UP YOUR RENT, AND ANYONE WHO HELPS THESE BASTARDS SHALL BE EVICTED IMMEDIATELY!!!!” Bambi shouted out with all of her anger at you, and it actually deafen’s your ears for a bit, but you are in absolute shock and horrified that this new landlady just kicked you and Candace out, and why you might ask, because you are a human in her “no human” rule.

“That is such bullshit landlady, you cannot do that.” you complained, at this was just bullshit on every level. However, what you just said just made her even madder than ever, and she even grabs you and looks all scary right then. “YOU AND YOUR ZOMBIE LADY EITHER GET OUT, OR I WILL KICK YOU OUT MY…”

“WHOLE IT RIGHT THERE…” yelled by another monster just as she comes by. It was the gargoyle Petra. “These people yes may be behind payments, but it’s only one, and they are currently working it… “Petra tried to say to intervene for you, however this only makes Bambi punch her in the (balls, but she doesn’t have any, but in that area). “YOU… YOU ARE EVICTED AS WELL!!!!!!!!!” Bambi yelled.

Well this is now unfair now. Not only you and Candace are evicted suddenly for having a human, but Petra is now evicted for standing up to her. What else could she do next, but she is worse than Nefernina, that’s for sure.

What happens now?
12433.title: Immediate Eviction!

choices: Guess we end up living in another town
124331.content:
(Sorry about the Candace thing, it's really Cadence now, thanks for letting me know)

It was the worst possible day for an eviction, as not only you were kicked out of the apartment overall, but because of a reason development that has occurred lately, they are no openings at all for houses or apartments, or even homeless people. Bambi already called Nefernina to inform her that you are kicked out, along with Petra because of this incident, and she was happy for you getting kicked out. Petra had to call her sister Janet to come and pick her up and her stuff as she has to move out thanks to her involvement in the fight, that got tons of outrage anyway. Several other monsters right afterwards were pretty mad as well, but thanks to Bambi's threat, they couldn't help.

"Man this day sucks." you said to Cadence just as walks and takes her stuff. "Guess we have to move somewhere else. To Terrordale!" you told her, and this got her snapping in a moment, and she grabs you right then. She growls, etc. "What Cadence?" you asked her, and then she shows you the paper. "Oh, I heard. The rivalry between the two cities were big. Well...." you thought about for a moment.
124331.title: Moving on to Terrordale

choices: Great, I will take that offer.
Uh... it's nice and all, but I rather look somewhere else.
1243311.content:
You knew you were going to have to say it, because really there is no choice at this point for you and Cadence. You might get into a lot of trouble and could possibly strain your friendship with Cadence doing this, but you know what, screw it, you are going to have to say it, and in hopes of her understanding the situation and taking it seriously, well, it’s going to have to happen. “Look Cadence, I am really sorry that I have to say this, but we really do have no choice. I mean the other towns are as far as hell, plus I don’t know if you will be able to move back in with your family, but, we have to do something Cadence. We are moving to Terrordale. Heck, maybe we can tell our friends not to kill us if some war were to start. Just bear with me Cadence, please?” you told her, in hopes that it might win approval points with you, and then she shook her head yes, understanding your concern, etc. She shook her head up and down, saying yes, much to your relief.

“Okay, I am glad for that. Let’s get going.” You said, just as Cadence gets into her vehicle and starts heading towards Terrordale.

/

A few hours later

/

Just a few hours after the whole massive fight that occur back at Horrorville, that got you and Petra kicked out of the house, you ended up moving to Terrordale and began looking at the many houses, all of them filled with mythical monsters. You looked at many of the houses, and thankfully the prices are affordable, but then you found an excellent apartment area that even houses the humans there, and heck, they are tons of jobs available for humans in Terrordale. Terrordale is not just known for the beach and monsters, it’s also well-known human tourist location that humans can also live in without much problems. Here, monsters and humans co-exist real well, unlike Horrorville that humans might have problems fitting in.

Just as you and Candence find the human/monster apartment that has decent size, space, and etc, (You were riding on Cadence’s shoulders during this whole thing) you were greeted by another monster. The monster appeared to be human, but she was deep cold and pale in skin, and then you saw ice shards all over her body. She is a Shiva like woman if you had to put it this way, and she was even wearing a blue bikini. Many people call her Elsa, the Ice Queen, and she is the landlord of this apartment.

“Well, I can see you coming here to find a great and affordable place to live in, heck, we always think for the humans who come to live here, so we have the human/monster apartments.” Elsa said just as she introduces herself just as she reveals her ice and covers herself with it (she isn’t a human, but she is a Shiva like girl). “I am Elsa by the way, and you two must be…”

“Well I am R.L, and the zombie friend I have here is Cadence.” You told her, introducing her and Cadence to you, with Cadence giving you a smile and a rubbed head. “Say, we just got kicked out of a Horrorville apartment because of some crazy landlord fight I had earlier, and I hope you don’t get on to us.” You told her, admitting that you and Cadence came from Horrorville, but Elsa seems to understand. “Well that kinda sucks, but at the same time you came to the right place, as we have a great policy here. Your first 3 months here (along with gas, electricity, etc) are free, and then afterwards you start making payments, and heck… the payments are really good here as they aren’t too expensive. Just imagine a good life you could live within the next few months?” Elsa told you and Cadence to get you excited for a good living opportunity.

“Well that is great, but I don’t have a job at the mom…” you tried to tell her that thing, but then Elsa interrupts again. “Well that ain’t a problem, as this apartment can help you find a job in no time. So… what do you say?” she asked you in a nice tone before telling one other thing. “One other thing, the monsters and I who live here, we don’t have any issues with monsters from many city, unlike many others though.”

So, what do you think?
1243311.title: We have no choice

1243312.content:
Cadence grunts and you let out a sigh. "Okay. No Terrordale. But what do you care Cadence? You weren't born in Horrorville." Cadence moans again. "Okay. But where do we go from here." Cadence pointed to three possible locations. First was a big city similar to Horrorville, but much bigger. It was called Fearfield and as you look you gulp. Fearfield was known for having a large number of restaurants that served human cuisine. Humans as cuisine that is. It was also home to Under Gloom, the world's nastiest woman's prison. However, it was also home to the Daily Tombstone newspaper. Perhaps you could get a job working there. Cadence was a writer after all.

Then there was some place called Dreadberry. It was a small town out in the country. Not exactly what you're used to, but maybe the suburbs would be better than the big city. You read that the town was mostly quiet, but the people themselves had their quirks.

Last was Panicburg. Of the possible thousands of cities in the monster world, Panicburg was said to be a wretched hive of scum and villainy. It was so bad that the entire police force consisted of gargoyles. You gulp because you didn't like the idea of going into a town populated mostly by criminals.

So What choice do you have?
1243312.title: Terrordale isn't an Option

12433121.content: So which will be yours and Cadence's new home? The big city of Fearfield or the small country town of Dreadberry?
12433121.title: Fearfield or Dreadberry

124331211.content:
"Well," you tell Cadence. "Fearfield looks like as good a place as ever. Look at all those vacancies." Cadence lets out a grunt and soon the next day, the two of you are on a bus heading for Fearfield. Along the way, you're speaking to Petra into Cadence's cellphone. "So Petra," you say. "How are you doing?" On the phone, your gargoyle friend lets out a sigh. "Well," she says. "My kid sister had a spare room she never uses so I got lucky. I'm sorry you two had to leave town."

"Well, Fearfield sounded inviting," you say. "As long as I stay away from the predators. Isn't Fearfield home to that big prison Under Gloom?" On the other end of the phone, Petra nods her head. "Yes," she says. "And it's run by Warden Destiny Sirtis. She's the meanest, strictest warden they've ever had and she's got a real nasty temper." You let out a gulp. Destiny sounded like somebody you didn't want to piss off. "What species of monster is she?" Petra drinks a bottle of water before answering you. "The same kind as me. But, whatever you do, what your mouth around her. Destiny is a little sensitive about her appearance." "Why?" you ask. "Is she super obese or grotesque or something?" Petra bites her lip before answering. "Let's just say that she looks somewhat.... demonic." "Demonic?" you ask to yourself. What could Petra mean about that. Well, whatever the case, you definitely didn't want a prison warden angry with you. "Well," says Petra. "Good luck." With that she hangs up.

Cadence places you on her right breast so you could read the paper with her and you look out the apartments and houses available for rent. "It says here there are two apartments that are looking for tenants. One of them is on the East side and the other is on the West side." Cadence moans and nods her head. "The only question is," you say. "Where are we heading?"

(Note: I have 2 ideas for where this is going so I'll add to the East and West paths just this once)
124331211.title: Fearfield

1243312111.content:
Cadence grunts and then points to an apartment on the East side of Fearfield. "I got it," you say. "So we're on the East side." As the bus keeps going East, you look outside to see a large mountain out the window. On top of the mountain was some really aggressive looking building that was covered in bars. It looked like a prison. Guess that was Under Gloom. It sure didn't look very inviting looking.

Soon, you and Cadence reach your stop. Cadence takes her bags as you ride on her head. Outside was a building called the Cabal House. Cadence lets out a groan. "Yeah," you say. "This doesn't look very inviting. But maybe it's better on the inside." Cadence and you walk into the building and at the front desk is the landlady. She was a 850ft tall Sasquatch girl who looked similar to your yeti friend Chel, except with black skin and reddish brown fur and she was wearing a pair of glasses. The Sasquatch girl looks up at you and Cadence before getting out of her chair. "You must be the new tenants," the sasquatch girl says. "I'm Harriet D. Henderson. I'll be your landlady." You hold your chin before looking up at Harriet. "Uh," you say. "Ms. Henderson. You wouldn't happen to know a yeti girl named Chel would you." "Chel?" asks Harriet. "You're friends with Cousin Chel? I haven't seen her in years. How's she doing?" "Last I checked she was doing fine." You say. Cadence grunts in agreement before Harriet hands her the key.

"Well," says Harriet. "I know what a horrible landlady you had at Monster Arms and you'll be glad to know I'm not like that crummy mummy." You sigh in relief but then you realize something. "Uh," you say. "Harriet. Is there a werewolf in this building?" You definitely didn't want to run into another werewolf. You heard Lupa had a big family and you'd hate to run into her relatives who might be as carnivorous as her.

Harriet let out a laugh. "No, no werewolves here. Although, your apartment is right next door to a married couple consisting of a werejackal and a werehyena." You let out a sigh. "Great. You say." Harriet smiled and then shakes hands with Cadence. "Welcome to Fearfield." The bigfoot girl says.

It isn't long before you and Cadence are unpacking and you breathe out a sigh of relief. "Well," you say as Cadence hangs several pictures on the wall. "It seems our luck is changing." Cadence grunts and smiles before nodding her head. Suddenly, there was a knock on the door. Cadence grunts and then walks to the door. That must've been the new neighbors, but exactly who were they?
1243312111.title: East Side

choices: You manage to hide from them
One of them picks up your scent.
12433121111.content:
Cadence opens the door and standing in front are your new neighbors. You look forward and see that one of them was an obese 800ft tall were hyena giantess with golden brown fur with black spots and long reddish hair. She appeared to have a psychotic looking grin on her face. You never liked that about werehyenas, their default expression was a slasher smile. The shorter one was an indigo furred and rose haired werejackal which meant this was the married couple Harriet mentioned. The werejackal appeared to have mismatched eyes; one was light blue while the other was pure red and disfigured looking. Obviously blind in that eye. Then you look in surprise because the werejackal was a woman. They were a lesbian couple.

Cadence moans as the were hyena giantess hands her what looks like a pie. "Hello," says the hyena woman in a voice that sounds similar to Cree Summer's. "You must be the new neighbor. The previous tenant moved out a month ago and we were beginning to think no one would move in there." The jackal woman then cracks a smirk. "My name is Aurelia Macbeth-Nile," she says. "And this is my wife, Cree." Cadence shook hands and moaned. They seemed friendly enough.

Cadence then grunts and looks at the pie. Aurelia and Cree might not be able to understand the zombie woman but at least Aurelia was able to tell what she was trying to say by context. "You want to know what kind of pie that is?" asked Aurelia with a smirk. "Only the most delicious kind. Human." You let out a gasp and cover your mouth before you hide behind one of Cadence's books on the table. Cadence is slightly horrified by hides her reaction. This was great, your new neighbors were human eaters. This was not good. You just hope you can hide from Aurelia and Cree before they leave.
12433121111.title: Cree and Aurelia

124331212.content:
Cadence mutters and waits for your response. "Well," you say. "How about a little southern charm." Cadence mutters and smiles and you give your giant zombie friend a high five. Looks like it's off to Dreadberry. You and Cadence get your things together and decide to head out to the city limits to get a ride to Dreadberry. Not exactly hard to do once Cadence holds out her leg to attract an orc trucker and get a ride.

Once the two of you reach the stop in Dreadberry, the trucker gives Cadence his number which Cadence subtlety disposes of before the two of you walk towards the town. You look up and have to hold your eyes. It was much more sunny in Dreadberry than it was in Terrordale. As Cadence walks down the street, you see that the suburbs, while hundreds of times bigger, it was not unlike any old small town. "This place looks like Kansas," you say. "For giant monsters." As the two of you walk down, you see a realtor down the street. She was an obese 660ft tall werefox with bright red-orange fur and bluish hair. on her lower chin was a beauty mark and was wearing a red business suit.

"Welcome to Dreadberry," she says as she smiles to Cadence. "My name is Meagan Reynard, I must say I'm sorry about your recent eviction from Horrorville. That's why I avoid those big cities." Cadence lets out a moan and Meagan looks in confusion before she spots you. "Cadence doesn't speak," you say. "I'm R.L. her roommate." However, Meagan lets out a growl and snaps her teeth at you as Cadence steps back. "Hey!" you yell. "Sorry," says Meagan bitterly. "I skipped breakfast, and I'm not particularly fond of humans. One of them broke my heart." You gulp but then Meagan gestures for Cadence to follow her as she leads her to a small, one floor house that was colored red and appeared to have piano keys for steps.

Once inside, Cadence takes a look around the interior of the place. First she inspects the well stocked kitchen that has a breakfast nook and tens of frying pans. Having spent years in a small apartment, the size of the kitchen was a major shock to Cadence, in a good way. Next, Meagan showed Cadence the bathroom and it had a bathtub as well as a shower. They didn't have tubs at Monster Arms. Finally, Cadence takes a look at the living room and flips through the channels on the wide screen TV. "I must say," you say to Meagan. "This isn't like anything back in Horrorville. Meagan smiles at that though she has to wipe drool from her mouth as she looks at you.

"So, do we have a deal Ms. Deadman?" Cadence grunts and then she signs the deed and Meagan sells her the house. "Well," says the fox giantess as she shakes hands with Cadence and walks away. "Welcome to the neighborhood." Well, it looked like things were looking up. "Well," you say to Cadence. "Our luck is changing." Cadence lets out a grunt.

You look to see that you have neighbors at both sides. The neighbor to the left appears to be some kind of feline monster. She looked like a cross between a lynx and an aged Pumyra from Thundercats. She had brown hair with a white streaked ponytail and humanoid face. She looked like she was in the monster equivalent of her fifties and had quite an ass on her. The cat giantess appeared to be hanging laundry. "What kind of monster is she?" you ask Cadence. Cadence lets out a mutter. "Splintercat eh?" you ask. "That would explain the ass."

Then you look to the right to see that next door there was a monster couple. Two minotaurs to be precise. You shudder given that a minotaur was the reason you were in this mess. But these two didn't look as bad as Bambi. The wife of the couple was a fat red furred cow woman wearing a crimson jacket and beret and was smoking a cigarette, while the husband was a muscular black furred minotaur in a grayish red shirt and jeans. Curiously he was waving to a passing gremlin girl when his wife wasn't looking.

Cadence lets out a grunt and you smile. "Well, maybe we should get to know the new neighbors." The question is, which one?

(For more information see this link to my other interactive, Monster Boondocks)
124331212.title: Dreadberry or Bust

choices: There's a Knock at the Door
1243312121.content:
Cadence sees the splintercat woman busy with her laundry and then decides to walk up to the fence separating your yards. You smile and kick back on your roommate's shoulder. As the splintercat continues hanging laundry, Cadence lets out a grunt to get her attention. Your new neighbor stops in her tracks and then turns her head to see Cadence waving at her and smiling. Though Cadence's smile is somewhat mitigated by her yellow teeth.

However, the splintercat moves a shirt out of the way and looks at Cadence with a grin. "Huh," she says. "Looks like Meagan finally sold someone that house next door. Welcome to Dreadberry. I'm Cattleya by the way." Cattleya holds up her hand and Cadence shakes it as she grunts and smiles. Cattleya however rolls her eyes. "And I guess you can't tell me your name. Ten thousand zombies in the world and only a handful of them can speak. Doubt I'll get much of a conversation out of this one." "Her name is Cadence." You say.

Cattleya mutters in confusion and then reaches into her pocket to take out a large pair of glasses. Once Cattleya has her spectacles on, she leans in closer and spots you on Cadence's shoulder. She gives a look of surprise that quickly turns into one of rage. "Oh great," she says. "A human. There goes the neighborhood." You didn't like the sound of that. This woman sounded a lot like Nefernina. "Uh, I'm R.L., Ms. Cattleya." Cattleya glares at you and then looks at Cadence right in the eye. "Please tell me that runt isn't your boyfriend." Cadence grunts and shakes her head as she waves her arms.

"You don't have a problem with humans do you?" you ask nervously. Cattleya lets out a hiss and shows you her fangs. "Of course I have a problem with humans! Especially that worthless son-in-law of mine!" Son-in-law? You've seen a lot of mean mother-in-laws on television but this woman was a giant monster with a human son-in-law. You don't know who that poor sap is, but you sure feel sorry for him. Cattleya places her teeth dangerously close to your level. "Since you're new to the neighbor R.L.," she says. "I'll give you a fair warning. If I catch you on my side of the fence, it's snack time." Cattleya snaps her teeth to show you she's serious.

This was terrific, your next door neighbor had the worst qualities of Nefernina and Lupa combined. What awful luck. Cattleya then resumes her laundry as Cadence backs away nervously. "Just our luck," you groan. "We're living next door to a monster just as mean as Nefernina." Cadence just lets out a grunt as you both walk back inside. "I think I'll stay inside for the rest of the day," you say. "I'll look for a job tomorrow. Hopefully they hire humans in this small town."

Well, hours pass and Cadence is busy typing at her computer while you watch TV. You look out the window to see that Cattleya woman taking down her dry laundry. You then walk up the walkway that Meagan had put in for you and look out the window to see into Cattleya's living room. You see several photographs on her mantle, one of which showed Cattleya as being much younger. It appeared to be a family portrait, right next to her in the photograph is a large muscle bound Nemean lion with gold colored fur. You're guessing Cattleya's husband, which is weird that you haven't seen him. You're betting he's deceased, given there appears to be a funerary urn in the living room.

Then you notice the rest of the photograph and see that Cattleya actually has two daughters. The older looking one was a green manticore with leather wings and purple hair and the younger one was a Nemean lion like her father, except she had white fur with blonde hair and green eyes and looked somewhat chubby.

The look through the window and see that the next photograph portrayed Cattleya's younger daughter, the Nemean lioness as an adult. Now she was very heavyset and appeared to be holding a baby mer-lion, you're guessing Cattleya's granddaughter. Curiously, part of the photograph seemed to be rubbed out with a sharpie around the lioness's shoulder. You then look to see in her living room, Cattleya has a dartboard that has a photograph of a human male, you'd say in his late forties. That must've been her son-in-law. Yeesh, that's the downside to marrying a giant monster. You hope if you wind up with a monster girlfriend, that she doesn't have any relatives like that splintercat.

Suddenly, Cattleya walks back into the living room and turns to her window, realizing that you're spying on her through your new house. She lets out an angry hiss in response and forces you to run. The splintercat giantess lets out a growl and gestures that she's watching you. And you thought Mavis was a bad neighbor.

What happens now?
1243312121.title: Bad Neighbor

choices: The Oxnards ask you to Stay For Dinner
You and Cadence Need to go Unpack
1243312122.content:
Cadence picks you up and then gestures to the minotaur couple on the right. You smile and climb your zombie friend's shoulder. "Okay," you say. "Hey, just because one minotaur kicked us out of our home, doesn't mean that these minotaurs can't be our friends. Let's get to know the new neighbors." Cadence grunts and then walks over into the next yard as the minotaur couple takes attention. The bull of the couple takes notice and then calls to his wife. "Lily," he says. "Look. We have new neighbors. Somebody bought the Henderson house next door."

Lily, the cow of the couple lights another cigarette before walking forward to you and Cadence and bending down to your zombie friend's level. You gag as the cigarette smoke hits you in the face and you're forced to duck down. There was probably enough nicotine in that thing to kill you. Lily inspects Cadence before taking out her cigarette and blowing smoke from her mouth. "How very interesting," the minotaur giantess says. "Harriet Henderson goes missing for three months and already two strangers are on her property." Lily's husband lets out a sigh and rolls his eyes. "For the last time Dear," he says. "I think Harriet just moved away."

Lily however is still skeptic. "Okay new neighbors. Tell me who is President of the U.S.A. in the year 4014." You raise an eye as Cadence grunts. "How the hell am I supposed to know that?" you ask. Lily picks you up and inspects you with her eye and even licks you before placing you back in Cadence's hand. "I must admit, you're a little underdressed for a time traveler." Cadence moans in confusion. Time traveler? What was that cow talking about? Lily smashes her cigarette into an ashtray and then wipes her brow with her beret. "Well," says Lily. "I'll be keeping an eye on you since you don't live too far away. The name's Una Tolkien." Una? But didn't her husband just call her 'Lily'?

"Don't mind my wife," says Angus. "Una Tolkien is the name she orders pizzas with. The name's Angus Oxnard." "Well," you say. "I'm R.L. and this is my roommate Cadence. It's a pleasure to meet you both. Cadence sits down at the patio table as Lily stares at her. "So a human sharing a house with a zombie?" You gulp nervously. "You don't have anything against humans do you." Lily shakes her head. "Are you kidding?" she asks. "I've been friends with a human for years. He's married to one of my good friends from school."

A monster human marriage? You didn't even know that was legal. "So what brings you city slickers out to Dreadberry?" she asks. "Well," you say. "Cadence and I got kicked out of our apartment recently." "Oh," says Angus. "I'm really sorry. What happened?" "Well," you say. "Our regular landlady, who is already a big old bitch one hundred percent of the time, hired a temp who kicked us out just because I was human." "She sounds horrible." Says Lily. You then give an uneasy look. "Well, to be honest we were hesitant to talk to you or your husband Mrs. Oxnard. It was a minotaur who kicked us out."

Lily takes out another cigarette and lights it before she responses. "Well," she says. "That heifer better hope I never find her. Around her I'm the president of my gun club." You were now suddenly afraid. You highly doubt that Lily was even mentally stable. That's when you notice Angus was smiling and waving at that same red gremlin girl across the street. The gremlin seemed to be blowing him a kiss and then you realize something.

You don't say it out loud but that minotaur bull was cheating on his heifer. For as much of a conspiracy theorist as she is, Lily didn't see the obvious. It was funny and sad at the same time. That's when you hear a squeezing nose and Lily produces a glass of milk. Obviously from her own udder. You and Cadence both look in pure disgust. "Care for some refreshments?" asks Lily. You look at the milk and mentally gag. "I'm lactose intolerant." You say.

There was no way you were drinking milk straight out of some minotaur's udder and given Lily being a chain smoker, it obviously wasn't safe to drink. Cadence however picks up the glass and drinks it to be polite. Once she's finished, her face turns a paler blue than usual and she begins to moan.

What happens now?
1243312122.title: The Bovine Couple

choices: "And You Have it All to Yourselves"
"But You'll Have to Share it With Another Monster"
12433122.content:
You let out a gulp. "Well Cadence, it looks like Panicburg is it." Cadence lets out a groan. "What do you have to worry about?" you ask. "You're already dead." Cadence grunts in agreement and then you look closer at the paper. Panicburg was voted the worst place to live in all of Mons Terra. There were crooks and killers everywhere. It was certainly no place for a human like you and you were painfully aware of it.

The next day, Petra was seeing you and Cadence off as you got on the bus to Panicburg. She was with her younger sister, Janet, a red skinned and pear shaped gargoyle girl with purple hair worn in a ponytail. "I'm really sorry you had to resort to this," says Petra. "Panicburg is a horrible place. You have no idea how dangerous it is." You let out a sigh. "We're sorry you had to move in with your kid sister." You say. Petra nods her head. "At least I have a place in Horrorville. You two be extremely careful." Janet then walks forward. "Don't worry. Our mom is police chief in Panicburg. We'll tell her about you." You nod your head as Cadence shakes hands with the gargoyle sisters.

Soon, you and Cadence are on the bus and it takes you past Terrordale and Fearfield and then three hours later, you're both in Panicburg. As Cadence gets off the bus and holds you on her shoulder, you look around and see that Panicburg is darker and filled with more smog that Horrorville and there was graffiti everywhere and even several burning drums. You could hear police sirens blaring and shiver. "This is a bad neighborhood," you say. "We better be careful." Cadence grunts and then spots the apartment building where you two will be staying. "The Dark Hand apartment building?" you ask. Cadence grunts. As Cadence walks towards the building, you see two white chalk outlines on the ground. One was distinctively ogre shaped and the other was distinctively griffin shaped. You let out a gulp. "I've got a bad feeling about this place."

You and Cadence walk into the apartment building and then you see the main office. Cadence knocks on the door before she hears a voice calling. "Come in." "That must be the landlady Cadence," you say. "I really hope we get along better with her than the last one." Cadence moans in agreement before entering the office. You look up and see that there were actually two landladies and they were both massive. Both of them were 950 feet tall, making them more than three times Cadence's size.

The first landlady was a bright crimson red furred wereboar woman with glowing yellow eyes and sharp teeth and four tusks. She was very obese and had long white hair reaching down to her considerable rear. She was wearing a black leather vest but looked naked from the waist down. The other landlady was a type of monster called a behemoth. She was a rose skinned monster resembling a hippopotamus with the thick skin of a dinosaur and a slightly elongated tail. She had long pink hair and an orange tattoo of a hippo's foot on her forehead. She was wearing a pink jacket, blue shirt and tight black jeans that looked about ready to snap off.

"Welcome to the Dark Hand," says the wereboar woman. "I am Erika." "And I'm her partner," says the behemoth woman as she shows her sharp hippo-like teeth. "Gloria. Is this your first day in Panicburg?" Cadence grunts and nods her head. "Well," says Gloria as the behemoth woman taps her bloated stomach. "I'd advise you to be careful. We're not one hundred percent sure, but some of your neighbors might be dangerous criminals." "But I can never remember which ones," says Erika as she lets out a snort. "So be on your toes. Apartment for one?" "Two actually." You say.

Erika and Gloria both spot you on Cadence's shoulder and look in surprise, but then they both smile and show their terrifying teeth. "Uh," you say nervously. "You don't have a problem with humans do you?" Both monster landladies let out a laugh. "Oh," says Gloria. "We don't have a problem. Erika and I love humans." Erika snorts in agreement. "But we have a special rule regarding human tenants." "And what's that?" you say nervously. Gloria and Erika let out fiendish laughs and your knees begin to shake. "Well," says Gloria. "Humans in this apartment have only one chance each month to pay the rent on time." "Or you'll evict me?" you ask.

Erika lets out a laugh. "Oh, you'll be evicted all right. Out the plumbing system." You're slightly confused but you gasp before you understand what Erika is saying. "You mean, you'll eat me?!" Gloria and Erika both lick their lips and nod their heads. "Of course," says Erika. "Humans are just divine." Erika smiles at you and you see human bones stuck in her monstrous looking teeth.

Cadence herself is somewhat spooked. "But don't worry," says Gloria. "I'm sure you're a responsible human. But in the event you can't make the rent, well, you get to decide which one of us gets to devour you. Just so you know, they usually choose me." Gloria then opens her mouth wide and you see a black hole that you hope you'll never have to see up close. Erika lets out a snort and holds out yours and Cadence's new room key. "You two are especially lucky. There's only one opening left..."
12433122.title: Panicburg

124331222.content:
"But there is one catch," says the wereboar woman with a snort. "You'll have to share it with another lady. My advise, try not to kill each other." Gloria lets out a laugh. "Erika," she says. "I told you to get your eyes checked. You're talking to a zombie." Erika hands Cadence the key before licking her tusk. "That's what you see," says Erika. "I'm talking to the human I plan to have for dinner the second he fails to meet the rent." Gloria lets out a giggle as you hide in Cadence's rotted ear. "Oh yeah, I just hope he fails so I can gobble him down." As both your new landladies laugh to themselves, Cadence takes the key and you and walks up to the third floor (there were five floors in the apartment building). "Be careful R.L.!" shouts Gloria up to you. "Try not to get eaten by any monster that isn't me!" The behemoth woman lets out a laugh at her own joke as Erika sticks out her tongue to lick her snout.

Cadence lets out a moan. "You said it," you say. "We've got two gnarly landladies who act just like Lupa. I don't know what sounds worse, being pigged out on by a literal pig or being bolted down a behemoth's belly." Cadence let out another bellow. "I know they were nice and all, but they still want to eat me. I wonder who our new roommate is. I really hope she isn't a criminal. You don't think Erika and Gloria were being serious do you?" Cadence actually mumbles in distress as she knocks on the door. The door opens and you see that your new roommate is...
124331222.title: Your Second Roommate

choices: You Go Out And Explore Panicburg
There's A Knock On The Door
1243312221.content:
The door opens and you see that your roommate is a rather tall werewolf. She looks to be about the same height as Petra, with red fur and long red hair made into a ponytail. She's got an amazon's figure but is still a little plump. "Hey roomie!" she says to Cadence, and then gestures for her to come in. Cadence enters the room and the wolf girl closes the door. "Its nice to meet you." she says. "My name's Autumn." Cadence shakes Autumns hand. "Uggh." she says. Autumn sniffs the air and then spots you. "Oh, a human! You gonna eat him?" she says as she reaches for you. Cadence quickly grabs you and holds you close to herself. "Uughh." she says. Autumn is confused until you speak up. "I'm Cadence's friend, RL. We were roommates back at our old apartment." you explain. "This tasty little guy's your friend?" the werewolf asks. "Takes all kinds I guess." Cadence relaxes a little and puts you on her shoulder. "So you won't eat me?" you ask nervously. Autumn leans in closer. "I can't make any promises." she says with a toothy smile. You hide behind Cadence's hair as the werewolf laughs.

"So where did you guys live before?" Autumn asks. "We lived in Horrorville." you tell her. "We got kicked out though, so we moved here." She laughs a little at your story. "So you moved to PANICBURG? I don't know if you're aware, but this place doesn't have the best reputation." she says. "We didn't have many options." you say. "Wait a second. You said Hororville? My cousin Lupa lives there." she says. You almost fall off of Cadence's shoulder. "Lupa's your cousin?!" you exclaim. "By that reaction I guess you've met her. She probably tried to eat you huh? I know I would." Autumn says with a chuckle. Looks like living here will be like dealing with Lupa twenty four seven. At least she seems friendlier than her cousin though.

As you and Cadence unpack Autumn tries to get to know you. "So what do you guys do for a living?" she asks. "Cadence here is a writer." you answer. Cadence nods with a grunt. "Cool, what about you?" Autumn says. You look away slightly before answering. "I'm sort of... seeking employment.' you say. "So you basically lived with her for free." Autumn says. You slump a little and Cadence laughs. Well, its more like a series of groans but you get the point. "I myself am an architect." Autumn tells you. "So you build houses and stuff?" you ask. "Yup." she answers. "I have a team to help with the work but I personally design and work on every project. I actually built one of my cousin's houses." She sounds like she's pretty successful. You wonder why she chose to leave here of all places. Once you and Cadence are comfortable...
1243312221.title: Autumn In Panicburg

12433122211.content:
After getting settled you and Cadence decide to get more familiar with Panicburg. "You sure you wanna do that?" Autumn asks. "Its a little rough out there. Maybe a bookworm like you should keep your head down." Cadence lets out a moan and walks to the door. Autumn stops her before she leaves. "Look, here's my number." she says while writing on a scrap of paper. "If you run into trouble just give me a call." She might be a predator but she sure is nice. "Thanks Autumn." you say gratefully. She leans in and scratches your head with a claw. "Don't mention it, I wouldn't want some other monster to take my snack from me." she says with a smirk. You smile nervously at her massive teeth. Its going to take some time to get used to such a friendly predator.

Soon you're outside walking down the street. Looking around you see that this place really is seedy. Its dark and dingy and makes you a little nervous. "Cadence, maybe we should have listened to Autumn" you say. "UUggh." she responds. "Easy for you to say, you're already dead." you say with your arms folded. Once you're about a block away from the apartment building something happens. Suddenly are dark shape steps right in front of you from the shadows, startling Cadence. You hold on tight to avoid falling off of her shoulder. Standing in front of you is a werebear, looming over Cadence. "Hey girlie, you new around here?" he asks with a smirk. Cadence starts to babble unintelligently while you gulp. He offers one of his large paws. "I can show you around.' Then an even larger shadow appears from behind you, dwarfing even the bear. He looks frightened and then turns tail and runs. Cadence turns around and you look up, way up. In front of you is a huge gargoyle woman, even taller than Petra. She's probably about 1300 feet tall. Her skin is a deep reddish orange and she's got gray hair that reaches past her shoulders. She has a great hourglass figure, kind of like Petra's.

"Wait a second," this new gargoyle as she leans closer for a better look. "A zombie and a human...are you Cadence and R.L.?" she asks. Cadence nods and the woman puts a claw on her shoulder. "I'm glad I ran into you! My daughters Petra and Janet told me you'd be coming! The names Gaia, I'm the chief of police here in Panicburg." she says. All the nervousness leaves you and you sigh in relief. So this is Petra's mom! Petra certainly takes more after her than her sister Janet does. They've got the same build and that same tough presence about them. "Um, thanks for helping with that guy." you tell her. Gaia picks you up and brings you to her face. "Don't worry about it, I promised my daughters I'd look out for you. Its horrible to lose your home and have to come to a place like this." she says as she holds you to her gigantic eye. Having this woman on your side certainly helps a bit. She's the chief of police, and must be pretty good if a huge werebear runs away from her like that. "Besides, you just have to know how to handle these crooks." she says. She also seems more open than the stoic Petra. Gaia then offers to give you a tour so you know your way around. "Not everyone here is bad." she tells you. "If you get to know the shopkeepers they'll look out for you too." She then guides you to some various shops. Where do we focus on?
12433122211.title: Meeting The Chief

choices: You Want To Browse The Shop
124331222112.content:
Gaia leads the two of you to some shops. It looks pretty normal, and you don't think she'd take you anywhere dangerous. "Now you can run into trouble just about anywhere in Panicburg, but it pays to have friends." Gaia tells you. She then takes you inside one of the various stores. When you enter you see a chubby woman whose skin is blue. Her hair is long and appears to be made of water, circulating on her head. "Hey Brook." Gaia says. The woman looks over and smiles. "Oh hey Chief, what brings you here? Looking for a good book?" Its then that you notice you're standing in a bookstore. "Not today, I'm just showing some newcomers around." Gaia tells her. Brook comes over and greets you. "Welcome to my shop. We've got every kind of book you could want, but it might take you a while to finish one." she says eyeing you. You laugh at the joke and look around. "Panicburg doesn't seem like a place where people like to read though." you say. "Oh, everyone likes to read." Brook tells you. "What really gets me business is the fact that customers are always safe in my shop. Not many people want to mess with a water elemental." That explains the watery hair. "They probably have some of your books here Cadence." you note. Brook then gets close to Cadence's face. "Wait a second. Cadence? Cadence Deadman?" she asks. Cadence grunts and nods. "Well I'll be! A celebrity in my shop!" Brook says. Cadence just moans but you know if her blood still flowed her cheeks would be red. "Well don't you two worry, if I hear you're in trouble I'll help you out." Brook tells you.

After leaving the bookshop you see another shop. "Whats this place?" you ask as Cadence goes inside. Gaia comes in right after you. "You don't want to come here." she tells you. "Now, now, Chief Maza. I'm just making a living." a voice says. You see that the voice belongs to a kitsune woman. She's got reddish brown fur and is a little on the thick side. She comes over and offers her hand. "Crazy Reddy, but you can call me Reddy. Customers are like family, so lets drop formalities eh?" she says. This woman seem really likable. "I wouldn't fall for anything." Gaia says. "Reddy here sells some pretty sketchy stuff. She's just lucky I haven't found a reason to bust her." Reddy smiles at the gargoyle. "All of my wares are one hundred percent legal." Then she turns to you. "Oh and a human? Well I bet I even have something you would like little buddy." she says and walks to the counter. Her bushy tail sways in a way that accentuates her rear, making you stare. Gaia sees this and rolls her eyes. "Watch out, she's got a silver tongue." she warns. "I just like to get to know people." Reddy says. "Customers are like family to me." You look around at all the stuff. "How do you deal with troublemakers?" you ask. "Kitsunes are really good with magic." Gaia explains. "Reddy here is adept at teleportation spells." Reddy folds her arms proudly. "At the sign of trouble I can whisk myself and the shop away to an undisclosed location, only to return a while later. Its to the point where people don't really try to rob me anymore." Wow, these shops are good at dealing with riff raff. What next?
124331222112.title: Water And Liar

choices: An Actually Serious Criminal Shows Up
1243312221121.content:
"Alright lets get out of here." Gaia says and ushers you and Cadence out. "Come back soon!" Reddy calls as you go. "Reddy herself is pretty harmless but don't let her trick you. Sometimes you might find a good deal but usually her stuff's either overpriced or faulty." Gaia informs you as you once again hit the street. "So Chief Maza, have you always lived here?" you ask off topic. "No, I used to live in Horrorville." she says. "I used to be the best cop they had, and that was while raising three daughters! Once my girls all grew up and left home though I was offered the job here as chief. I try my best but I can't be everywhere at once so its still pretty bad around here." Then she laughs as she remembers something. "When I first came here the local crooks didn't take me seriously, then one behemoth who though he was tough ended up with a broken jaw."

As Gaia talks more you think that she's much more open than her daughter. "If you don't mind me asking, what was Petra like as a kid?" you ask. "As far as I know she's usually calm and stoic." Gaia nods with a smile. "Yeah, she's a tough one., also the only one who followed in my footsteps and became a cop." she tells you. "Don't get me wrong. Her sisters, Roxy and Janet can hold their own, but they aren't cut out for police work." Gaia then stops and reaches into her back pocket. She pulls out a wallet and pulls out a picture for you to see. In it are three young gargoyle children. You recognize the orange one as Petra, and there's a smaller red gargoyle next to her. Behind them with her arms around their shoulders is a taller yellow gargoyle. "This is before Petra hit her growth spurt." Gaia says. "After she shot up she became taller than Roxy. Then Janet and Roxy got bigger and rounder." she laughs as she reminisces about her kids.

While Gaia chats with you someone suddenly runs past her from behind and pushes Cadence aside.You are thrown from her shoulder and grab onto the runner's shirt to keep from hitting the ground. You see that its an orc girl and that she managed to grab Cadence's wallet as well. From what you can tell this girl isn't very subtle and probably only got away because she targeted a zombie. Any other monster would have reacted fast enough. Also from you position you can see Gaia on the girl in a flash. She pushes the girl to the ground and holds her arm behind her back. "Really? How green are you? Pickpocketing with the chief of police right there?" she says almost laughing. You are picked up by Gaia's claws and placed on her shoulder. "You okay R.L.?" she asks. "Yeah, just a little shaken up." you answer. Gaia lifts the struggling orc by the scruff of her jacket. "well I should get this rookie criminal to the station." she says. "You two should come along too. Think of it as part of the tour." Then...
1243312221121.title: Getting To Know Gaia

12433122212.content:
Suddenly there's a knock on the door and Cadence freezes in place as you hide behind her hair. Autumn gets off the couch and the werewolf giantess walks out to get it. "Don't worry you two," says Autumn. "I'll get it. I invited a friend over to meet my new roommates." Cadence lets out a nervous groan. "Oh man," you say. "So far we've met three human eating monsters. Please don't let this one be another predator." Cadence let out a moan and then you gasp. "You're right Cadence. This could be a criminal. Gloria and Erika did say some of the tenants might be crooks."

Cadence bites her nails and you cross your fingers as Autumn opens the door. But who is at the werwolf's door?
12433122212.title: A Knock On The Door

choices: Autumn takes you and Cadence to Daphne's Welcome Party
124331222121.content:
Autumn opens the door and you and Cadence see that at the door is a strange purple furred monster resembling a wildebeest. She had bright rose colored scales on her back with hot pink hair that covered her eyes, long fangs and stripes on her body. The wildebeest like woman was obese with a large stomach and thighs and was wearing nothing but a white vest. "Daphne!" yells Autumn as she shakes hands with her friend. "Come on in, I want you to meet my new roommates."

The new monster, Daphne, walks in and smiles as she appears to be carrying a pizza box that she lays on the table as she lowers her head to Cadence's level. "Welcome to Panicburg," she says. "A zombie eh? That will come in handy in this town." Cadence laughs nervously before she notices you. "Uh hello," you say. "I'm R.L. and this is Cadence." Daphne leans in closer and opens her mouth. You take a whiff of her breath and begin to gag. It smelt absolutely toxic. "Wow," says Daphne. "So Autumn has a human roommate. I wouldn't be surprised if you woke up in her belly the next morning. I'm Daphne by the way." Daphne holds out one of her titanic fingers for you to shake. "Uh," you say. "I mean no disrespect Daphne, but what kind of monster are you." Daphne lets out a snorting laugh. "I'm a catoblepas, a monster from Ethiopia. The name means 'to look downwards'."

"Odd name," you say. "Uh, can you see me well with your hair over your eyes." Daphne gives a smirk. "You don't want me to pull my hair up. If you look into my eyes, you'll become a paperweight." You step back and cover your eyes as you shake. "I see," you say. "You know, back in Terrordale, we lived directly over a gorgon." Daphne let out a giggle. "So they have apartments that allow humans there as well?" You look slightly confused, but then Daphne reaches into a pocket on her jacket and what she takes out next surprises you.

Standing in Daphne's hand was a young human man around your age who had long red hair and was wearing a pair of glasses. You look in surprise as the human guy waves at you. "R.L.," says Daphne. "This is my boyfriend, H.P." "Hello," says H.P. "I didn't think any other human would move here. Especially after Erika ate the last human tenant who moved in here." You couldn't believe this. Another human in the apartment building before you? Erika and Gloria must've wanted more humans around to prey on.

Cadence holds out her own hand and you walk up and shake hands with H.P. "Huh," says H.P. "Necrophile huh? Did you date her when she was alive." Cadence and you both look in surprise. "What? No! Cadence isn't my girlfriend. I don't have a girlfriend. Although there was a basilisk at my old apartment who had the hots for me.

Autumn lets out a laugh in the background. "Yeah, and my cousin tried to eat him up." Daphne snorts and then opens the pizza box, revealing a perfectly made pizza that smelled absolutely heavenly. It was most likely made of monster food, but even you couldn't resist the smell. Cadence picks up a piece and bites into it before shoveling it in and moaning in ecstasy as she chews it. You pick up a tiny piece yourself and eat it. It tastes awesome.

"Wow," you say. "This is the best pizza I've ever tasted." Autumn takes a piece herself. "Daphne runs a pizzeria near here. She hand makes every pizza herself." Daphne blushes and then puts H.P. down to speak with you as you both pick off pieces of the pizza. "You've got serious guts moving to Panicburg," says H.P. "This city has the lowest rate of human survival in the monster world." As Daphne and Autumn are talking, you walk up to H.P. "But you managed to find a nice monster girl who doesn't eat humans."

H.P. looks up and sees Daphne distracted before speaking with you. "Daphne does eat humans." He says. You gasp. "One of Daphne's specialities is pizza with human toppings," says H.P. It's kinda how I met her. She made a pizza for herself and I somehow survived getting cooked. She was too full afterwards to eat me but before she could save me for later, I managed to sweet talk her into a steady relationship. Daphne hasn't stopped eating people but I'm an exception and maybe if you're lucky she'll make you an exception too." You were stunned. This guy had a girlfriend who ate humans and yet she's dating him. "R.L.," says H.P. "I'm not going to lie to you. Most monsters in this apartment building, if not all, are human-eaters. I've been nearly swallowed hundreds of times. Just last week, Autumn had me over her mouth. Daphne's roommate, this big woolly were rhino giantess, one time I woke up and she had me in a sandwich. Even Daphne's licked her lips at me a few times. You need to be careful."

You let out a groan. This apartment was sounding more dangerous by the second. Daphne then turns her focus to Cadence and you. "Say," says the catoblepas giantess. "I'm throwing a party at my place to welcome you two to the neighborhood. Sound interesting to you." You look nervously but Cadence grunts and nods her head before picking you up and placing you on her shoulder. "Excellent," says Daphne. "All the other tenants will be there, so be ready in an hour. Autumn will show you the way. Come on H.P." Daphne picks up her boyfriend and places him in her armpit before walking away."

Autumn smiles at you and Cadence both and wags her tail. "Well, you two are gonna meet the whole gang. Oh and R.L." "Yes?" you ask. "Try not to wind up in another monster girl's belly. If anyone's gonna to eat you, it'll be me." You let out a sigh. You just hope that there's enough snacks at the welcome party that Daphne's friends aren't tempted to swallow you.
124331222121.title: Autumn and Daphne

choices: You begin to help Melonie with her life style
Melonie's kids comes back home from school
1243312222.content:
Cadence opens the door to the apartment that you, her, and one unknown monster will be sharing to see that the room is an absolute mess on all levels. Somehow it makes you want to hurl to your stomach as not only was the room a mess in every way you can possibly imagine, but it also smells as if someone is doing drugs and doing crack as well. You can see that they re cigarettes and its ashes all over the place, along with massive panties, bras, food objects all over the place that smells like it has rotten like a stink beetle. You can also look to see that there is tons of paint all over the room, and the bed is shred to no end, and also the TV and other stuff either looks broken, or just plan bad looking. After looking at the TV, maybe it isn't bad, and there is a cable box and other stuff, but nothing can prepare for you for what you saw next. Not only it single handedly explains why the room is a complete mess, but also why it smells so bad. You actually had to cover your nose just so you don't get repulse, and Cadence understands your pain. Even though she is dead like a zombie, if she was able to smell or if she is smelling right now, it absolutely disgusts her just as much as you.

Sitting on a big massive couch that fat people would sit on is some sort of a brownish Bigfoot like creature, only it was wearing a big ass white shirt and huge jeans, but has massive breasts and the face actually looks very girlish and with green eyes and lipstick. It was also very hairy as well, and it has for teeth two massive tusk like teeth. Give or take height wise it is at least around 1000ft tall, but the weight is like almost like million pounds at least. Give or take, this is exactly how this girl weights, but at least she is somewhat pretty, but still, you don't want a fat person in your life. This is a Yowies, a mix between a Bigfoot, apes, and a human if you want to call it that way. Your eyes just cannot stop looking at it, I mean her weight is like a beast itself, and still she is pretty somehow. She was watching TV when you and Cadence came and knock on the door, and she struggles to get up and go the door to open it. When she opened it, she saw a very tiny human (you) and Cadence. "Hello there." she said really nicely, especially looking at you just as she tries to grab you, but Cadence didn't let that happen, not because she is in love with you, but more likely you would get crushed by her.

"Well uh.... hi." you said extremely nervously just as you continue to smell and look at her god awful apartment that reeks like a skunk. The Yowie looks at you and then replies. "I apologize for the mess in the room and how it reeks, but to me it's nice the way it is." the yowie said just as she struggles to walk all the way to her couch to continue watching some reality show. "I am Melonie, and I hope that we can be good friends." she said. "Well okay. I am R.L. and the zombie girl who is with me is Cadence." you introduced yourself, and Cadence smiles at you for the introduction you did for her.
