13313.content:
It takes a bit of effort to open the chest--not that the lid is heavy, but the hinges are so old and worn that they're gunked up with rust. You can even see little puffs of it fall to the floor as you push the lid back, grinding the rust into a red power. Opening the lid also stirred up a lot of dust; it's so bad you have to cringe away and cover your mouth to keep from breathing the stuff in. Damn, even without any hostile monster-women to worry about, this infernal place was bad for your health!

Swearing under your breath, you turn back to the chest and look inside.

There's nothing within but a book. An old book, with a faded binding that looks a lot like leather...but still; just a book. There didn't even seem to be a title.

Damn. You find something interesting--another human lived here before you!--and all you get is an old book. Talk about a rip-off--given how old the thing was, the writing had probably faded by now anyway. And since whoever owned it had "moved out" without getting all their things first, the unfortunate human was likely long dead--

Wait a minute--there was a bookmark tucked under the cover you hadn't noticed before. It was a strip of cloth, and it looked familiar...

Curiosity returning, you reach down and grab the book. Touching the cover reveals that it is in fact bound in leather, and as you lift it you find that it's a bit heavier than it looks. You spare a quick glance over at Izzy, and find the basilisk woman still busy with untangling the lights--and judging by the distressingly large ball of tangled wires next to her, she had her work cut out for her and likely wouldn't notice you rifting through the chest. Satisfied that no trouble will come from this, you look back at the book, or more accurately the bookmark within.

That's when your jaw drops. The bookmark, the cloth...it's from Nefernina's wrappings! It's unmistakably from your ill-tempered, sadistic landlord: the worn-yet-tough look, the stretched texture from wrapping around her frame; it was hers, no doubt about it. You knew that blasted cloth all too well; you'd gotten closer looks at it than you wanted when she'd "accidentally" stepped or sat on you. The sight of a building-sized behind descending on you like the fist of God wasn't something you'd forget anytime soon.

So why the hell was it at a human scale? And being used as a bookmark, of all things?

Heartbeat quickening, you crack open the book to a random page and start reading. The date is torn away, but the rest of the entry is legible.

Starting to get the ice spells down, finally managed to get the icicles sharp enough. Turns out all you need to keep the stuff from melting before they can skewer someone is to add some sawdust and little bits of wood. Hell if I know how it works; if it keeps my death-traps from turning into puddles, I'm happy.

Spells? That was weird. You'd never heard of humans being able to use magic, and as far as you knew the only spell-slinger around was...
You freeze. Your eyes leap up from the page and stare into space, wide as dinner plates, and your whole body goes rigid. There was no way; it had to be some weird coincidence...you force your eyes back to the page and force yourself to focus on the words. One passage in particular.

"CleoFATra"? Seriously?! That's what these damn humans call me?! They think that's clever or something; what are they, five years old?!? I ought to--
The rest of the page is a string of profanity and horrid fates for anyone; human or monster, who used that nickname. But that goes over your head. There's only one important detail here.

You just found Nefernina's diary!! Normally you'd never even consider such a thing, simply due to how it gave the mummy a perfect excuse to kill you. Or worse. But this? This was something you'd never expected. From the size of the diary, and the piece of cloth used as a bookmark, it seemed that Nefernina had been human-sized at one point.

She...she might have even been human, period.

There was NO WAY you were just letting this go. This diary could be useful. VERY useful. But you would have to study it further...that was the ONLY way you'd learn more. Steadying yourself, you slip the book into a pocket in your jacket and re-close the chest. Taking a deep breath to calm yourself, you stroll back around towards Izzy, hoping you look casual.

You find her looking rather frazzled, scowling as she stops. Her tail is twitching back and forth behind her, and she's even rubbing one clawed hand with another. Apparently, even monsters could get carpel-tunnel or hand cramps. But, surprisingly, the wires are mostly untangled. Guess she works faster than you thought. Idly patting the book within your jacket, you stroll up to the friendly basilisk and tap her on the leg. She looks down at you, her annoyed scowl melting into her usual cheerful grin.

"Oh, hey there R. L.! You've been looking around a lot?" She holds out a hand, palm up, giggling as you clamber on. She brings you up to her face, sitting down on a box.

You shrug, putting on your best aloof look. "Looking around? Yeah...not much TO look at, since I can't open boxes that're the size of buildings for me. Didn't run into any bugs, though; that's a plus."

Izzy giggles again, her snake-eyes looking bright with glee behind her glasses. You can't help but smile yourself. You may not be so keen on having a monster girlfriend, but she was still fun to be around sometimes, her cheeky way of hitting on you and asking for dates notwithstanding. "Sorry if you were bored, but I found the lights and got 'em mostly untangled, so they're pretty much ready". she reports, pointing a claw at the lights with her free hand. Then she tilts her head. "Hey, R.L.? I have to ask you something..."

1431321221221211111.content:
Life flashed through your eyes at that critical moment, and with Irene's gaping maw approaching and widening to devour you, you do what any sane person would do.

You scream.
And through it, you beg.

"Irene, please!! I was duped by Shelly! How was I supposed to know??! I don't even speak japanese, how was I to know about the effects?" you try reasoning with her, but seeing that your pleading wasn't working, you keep trying to reason with her, desperately so. "What will Petra say? Or Candance? I ALREADY TOLD YOU I'M SORRY!!"

You felt a sudden stop, as you hung right above the cyclopean woman's mouth, who thankfully closed. Her glare still remained, though. "Didn't you hear me, flea? At this point I. Don't. Give. A. Damn." she stressed each word with venom for emphasis. "You ruined me, you ruined my figure, and all the effort I wasted to stay healthy and fit is GONE. FOREVER."

Unfortunately, to your great dismay, Irene starts opening her mouth again, and you feel her grip on you loosening slowly, as if to torture you with a slow but iminent death. Gears grinding at Mach 5 in your head, you urgently think back at what she said, how she was before this whole disaster was unleashed.

"WAIT!! Irene, please wait! I've just thought of something, something you could benefit from!" Her grip holds, and her mouth closes again, much to your relief.

"...you're just trying to buy time, aren't you, worm?" said the cyclops, baring her teeth at you. Sensing the precious time you just bought going to waste, you inhale sharply, and let it all out, panic still occasionally shaking your voice.

"Look, Irene, I know how much you love exercising to be the pinacle of health and fitness, and you gotta admit, you enjoyed the adrenaline rush you got from knowing you lost weight, got some muscle, stayed sickness-free, right? Think about it, this outbreak is all over the news, and if you manage to lose weight through sheer force of will and physical effort, you'll get recognition, a lot of it." as you spoke as clearly and quickly as you could, Irene listening with her eyebrow arched, a thought of joy crossed your mind, you were getting through to her! "Can you imagine the fame you'll get if you manage to fight the nebutori? Or even how you will inspire all the others to follow your lead? You'll be famous, Irene."

She strokes her flabby chin with her free hand, pondering your idea, before sniggering and smiling at you. Her smile however, was less than reassuring. "I think you hit your head really hard, because that is complete asinine. But thanks for the laugh." she once again raises her hand holding you above her mouth, widening it to swallow you. Talk about deja vu.

"You're not listening! I know it's going to be really hard, with the sickness making you lethargic and all, but I also know you're the kind of gal that won't give up! So you'll start all over again, so what? You can do it! You're not going to let the nebutori win! I know you're mad at me, and I'm genuinely sorry for my blunder, but if you eat me now, you'll just be giving up and accepting the nebutori's effects! I can help you, please, just GIVE ME A CHANCE!!" You close your eyes, as your life literally hangs by a thread.

But once again, you feel her grip tightening instead of loosening. Opening your eyes, you blink at Irene's seriously pissed face. She sighs, and lowers her meaty hand, allowing you to climb to the soft palm of her hand. Looking up to her, you thank her for her patience and lower your head in shame. "I'm sorry for ruining all your hard work, but I'm willing to help you get back in shape. I'll motivate you in any way I can, this I swear, and if I don't keep my promise, you can eat me, or give me to Lupa, she's not worried about her figure, at least."

"Hah, that remains to be seen, twerp. And you're right about Lupa, that overfed mutt only thinks of food." she lowers her titanic cherubic face to her hand, her single eye gazing at you with such an angry intensity, you feared for a second she'd fire a laser beam and burn you into ashes. "Fine, you win this time, but as of now, you're under my supervision. You'll be my coach, and help me lose all this flab until I regain my toned body, if not better. Three weeks is how long Chel said we need until that last ingredient for the cure. Three weeks to help me shed weight, and you'd better deliver, for your sake..."

You swallow hard before you get another idea, to further help the cyclopean giantess...

14313212212212111111.content:
"Hang on, what if I moved in with you?"

You blurted that out, without properly thinking it over. Irene just stares at you, her single eye twitching and her expression twisting into one of disgust and surprise."...say what." is all she manages to mumble, while you rub the back of your head sheepishly. "That is one very weird way of coming on to me, beansprout."

Mentally slapping yourself for your poor choice of words, you try again. "I mean, I would move into your room to help motivate you and work out with you, or cheer you up or something, at least until this whole ordeal is over. As I said earlier, the nebutori is making you lethargic, but with some motivation and force of will, I think you can lose the weight. Here's an example, earlier, you could have just done what everyone else was doing, instead of taking their frustrations out on me, or flat out EAT ME, they just glared and gave up. You (and Lupa to an extent) just went for it, I mean, me. You didn't let the sickness stop you from, well, erasing me from the map." all the while, Irene just nods slowly, mulling it over. After a few seconds of pause, she rubs her chipmunk-like cheek with her free hand.

"...That is true... I was so consumed by my desire to get payback on you, I practically didn't feel tired or sleepy, or even hungry for that matter... fine." with a ponderous grunt, she begins waddling up the stairs. "But first, if you're going to be my 'coach', as you say, you're going to get yourself patched up." she puffs out, laboriously, and you cannot help but look at the cyclopean behemoth of a woman carrying you, surprised.

And while nothing's stopping me of forcing you to exercise with me in that current condition, I'm not a sadistic bitch like Nefernina. I don't like torture. So you're getting yourself patched up, pronto, so we can begin working this load off." she grabbed a handfull of her belly fat with her free hand and shook it for emphasis. You nod slowly, wincing as the pain on your left leg made itself known again, the fear of being eaten by the angry cyclops momentarily made you forget the wound.

"...Thanks... and sorry." you mutter, shamefully. Your carrier, however, just snorts, frowning.

On the way there, you cross paths with Izzy and Lupa, the latter of which was panting and leaning against the wall. Izzy takes a few steps forward, a mix of relief and aprehension plastered on her face, as she sees you alive but still in Irene's grasp. She readies herself to take you away, but you raise a hand and wave, signalling her that you were fine, well sorta, on the inside you were trying desperately to conceal the pain and discomfort emanating from your busted leg. For your credit, Izzy just relents, and shyly waves back, her arm fat and massive bosom jiggling as she does so and Lupa, again for your credit, simply does nothing, her attempt at catching you earlier and wrestling with Izzy left her completely exhausted, so all she did as you two passed by was pout angrily and pant.

When you finally reached Chel's room, Izzy knocked a few times, and the door opened to reveal...

1431321221221211111112.content:
... to both your relief and annoyance, Izzy. She entered with a panicked look on her face, eyes darting to every corner of Chel's home, squeezing past the wheelchair-bound tenant with a curt hello. "Well, excuse you, Izzy." mumbed the bloated yeti nurse.

"R.L.??! Where is he??! Lupa said she smelled blood on him, IS HE HURT?" she bawled, tears forming in her bespectacled eyes. You can't help but flinch a little at this, you don't need this, not right now. Taking a few steps forward (you realize you limped to a hiding spot behind some books layed out in the table, out of paranoia), you wave at the basilisk worrywart and call her name. As soon as she heard your voice, however, she was right on top of you. "YOUR LEG! WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU??"

"Relax, I just fell down the stairs, I'll be fine." you say as she grabs you and holds you up to her puffy face. Even with the added weight, she was still a beautiful woman. Her face darkened at your explanation, however, and before she can say anything, you tell her off. "And no, Izzy, Irene did not do this to me. In fact, she was the one who came up with the idea to bring me here." hearing this, Izzy's expression eased a bit, although she was still angry at Irene's earlier rampage. The nurse wheeled herself to the edge of the table, still annoyed at the sudden intrusion.

"He's right, Izzy. Now put him back on the table so he can relax a bit, the wound is still healing." Chel admonished your carrier, and she returned you to the table, as gently as she possibly could. Slowly and carefully, you sit down and stretch your leg, keeping it still. Whatever that medicine was, it was working, as you felt the wound throb with less pain, gradually. Chel cleared her throat, making you look up from your wound. "So, if you don't mind me asking, how exactly are you going to help Irene fight off the nebutori?"

"It's not really that special, I'll just move in with her and help motivate her to shed the weight. I mean, this sickness makes you lethargic and hungry, right? I'll push her buttons in order to keep her focused." you clarify, while the two females listen. "At the same time, I'll try to convince her that having a little pudge isn't such a bad deal, maybe even make her less of a hypochondriac." Chel nodded quite vigorously at your last remark, leaving you puzzled.

"Hmm... good luck with that. It's taking me a lot of willpower to keep myself from just staying in bed and eating junk food all day long... or what's left of it, anyways." she turned to the bespectacled basilisk and sighed. "I imagine it's the same with you, right?"

"Yeah. But, I mean, I was never on the thin side to begin with, so for me, I'm okay with it." her voice lowered a bit and she gave you a bit of a look. "I might even decide to keep it, I feel so soft and plushy..." you roll your eyes, what a flirt. Even with all this weighty chaos, Izzy still finds room to try and seduce you, guess somethings will never change...


A while passes, with the three of you chatting over past outbreaks that were on the news and how many people were affected, and by the time Chel tells you you're ready, your leg feels just as good as before, if not better. You jump and give a quick dash to test your leg muscles, under the nurses' supervision, and give her a thumbs-up. Izzy squees, happy that you're fine, but Chel doesn't share the sentiment. Walking up to the edge of the table, you ask her. "What's up? Aren't you glad I'm fine now?"

"Hmm? Oh, yes, but don't you find it strange that Irene isn't here yet? I mean, I know the added blubber must've slown her down a bit, but it's been five minutes since the time period I gave her." she points to a clock hanging on the wall. She was right, thirty-five minutes had already passed. Frowning, the bloated yeti turned to Izzy. "Could you take him to Irene's room? While he can go there himself right now, it may be best not to push his legs too much, it might cause discomfort if he uses them for too long right after healing up."

Chel's idea makes you groan while the basilisk simply nods in an enthusiastic manner. "What makes you think Irene's in her room?" you ask, eyebrow cocked. Chel just gives a sad smile, and points to her bloated apron of a belly. Then it hits you.

"I hope I'm wrong, but I cannot help but get this feeling that Irene's back in her home stuffing her face. I want to think she's stronger than that, but if not, then you'll need the best of luck to deal with her." with that, Izzy eagerly beckoned you to climb on to her hand, and placed you on her shoulder, while Chel wheeled herself to open the door.

Wonderful. You really hoped she was wrong.
1431321221221211111112.title: Reader's Choice

14313212212212111111122.content:
You breath a sigh of relief as you enter Irene's apartment. She was already setting up her treadmill and stairclimber, and she had pulled out several weights and barbells. And she had changed into her workout clothes, though they were strained against her bloated body. Seems Chel was wrong. Irene was determined to lose this weight.

"Hey Irene. You ready to get started?" You ask as you walk up to her.

Irene looked down at you and smiled. "I am. It was tempting to just plonk down on the couch and snack, but I'm not going to let a damn disease beat me! I am going to lose this weight one way or another!" She declared.

You smiled at that. Irene may have lost her figure, but she did not lose her drive. She picked you up and set you on her shoulder as you two began her workout.

You started with the weights. She got through the dumbbells easily, but the barbells proved to be a problem, since she had difficulty getting them past her now massive gut. But with her determination and your help, Irene got them up, and even got it more lifts. She wasn't even winded afterwards.

Then it was on to the stairclimber. This proved much harder, since Irene actually got winded quickly on it. But she kept pushing on, determined to beat this damn disease. You kept pushing her on, yelling encourgament in her ear. Eventually, she managed to do the equivalent of climbing 7 Monster Arms buildings.

The treadmill was next. It proved to be easier than the stairclimber, but harder than the weights. Her constant running meant her massive body kept jiggling, threatening to throw her off. And several times, you almost fell of her shoulder. But both of you held firm, and eventually, Irene ran 20 miles on the treadmill.

Eventually, Irene finished up. You could tell she was exhausted. But you also felt proud that she was able to do all of this.

"It used to be that I could run 50 miles on the treadmill. This stupid disease slowed me down." She said between pants.

"But 20 miles is still good. And you proved Chel wrong." You told her.

"Proved her wrong?" She asked.

"She thought you'd be gorging on food." You explained briefly.

That made Irene laugh. "Seriously? I may have been turned into a blob, but I'm not letting the nebutori turn me into a lazy pig."

You were about to reply when you heard a knock at the door. Slowly, Irene got up and waddled over to it. Open the door, you saw...
14313212212212111111122.title: Nothings Keeping Irene Down

143132122122121111111222.content:
... a centaur, bloated (as most of the tenants were) with the nebutori virus, her zebra-patterned legs resembling tree trunks with an ass that jiggled like jell-o, her horse gut nearly reaching the floor whereas her human torso looked like it belonged to a four hundred pound woman, were she a normal human being. Her long blue-toned hair was disheveled and messy, and she was half mumbling to herself and half hiccuping, all the while carrying several boxes of pizza.

"Zelda. What do you want?" groaned Irene, annoyed. Oblivious to the hostility emanating from the cyclopean butterball, the humongous zebra-like centaur just giggled with a dumb grin plastered on her round puffy face and leaned on the doorway.

"He-heya Aye-reene... Ya-hic- shee... ah wash hungree, an' befurr ah knew it, this cute hunk'a guy de-d-delivahred sum bawkses o'pizza, an-an-an -hic- THEN ah remmemburrd you's givin' up on that cuh-raayzee diet of yours... an so, he-here ah am!" her breath reeked of so much alcohol, she practically had a cloud of it surrounding her, making both you and Irene cringe in disgust and lean backwards. She must be the drunk of the apartment, as you've once heard Chell mention it during one of your check-ups. "Ah all-reaadee had me sum pizza, you's can have da resst!"

"Look, I was kinda in the middle of something, and no, eat that junk yourself, I already have enough flab to deal with." Irene was clearly not in the mood to deal with the drunkard's antics, much less with food (thanks to your 'coaching', you thought to yourself, smiling).

"Aww... you's shuuure about that... not even wunn or two bawkses? Ah baught theses 'cuz ah wass thinkin' bout yous...-hic-" the inebriated centaur wobbled forward, thrusting the boxes clumsily onto the equally-fat cyclops. She accidentally took a whiff of the boxes, and suddenly she started sweating. For good measure, you smelled the contents inside the boxes, and boy did they smell good. A thick, cheesy aroma emanated from the square containers, and looking over to your companion, you go pale when you see her earlier steel resolve vanishing into vapour in the face of this addictive junkfood. She just stood there, holding several boxes while muttering incoherently, stunned.

"Irene, no, don't." whispering to her, you try urgently to help her reconsider, but a sudden fit of giggles and hiccups interrupts you. Zelda thrust her pudgier hands on her wide centaur hips, a look of triumph in her flushed face. She seemed proud of her actions, almost.

"Weell, you's lookin' atta pizzas, eeh-hic-? They're ahwesum... oops!" Zelda slurred as she wobbled backwards, her colossal butt bumping onto the opposite wall. Leaving a completely beffudled Irene behind, she turned and waved drunkedly. "Ah gots tah get goin', ah gots me a hunk ta have sum -hic- fun with toniiiiight, byyyeeee!" woah wait, what? Was she referring to the pizza delivery boy? You were about to ask her when you catch the former athletic monster glancing at the boxes with a thin line of drool slowly going down from her mouth to her second chin.

"Irene... come on, don't you dare give in. Remember our talk, okay?" you admonish her, and she gives you a look that is half-pleading, half guilty, almost as if she was some puppy. A big... bloated... one-eyed... puppy. You sigh and try again. "Come on, you'll thank me later for this."

"But... RL... those have stuffed veggies in the crust... at least one slice wouldn't hurt, right? I earned it today..." your stern gaze made her single eye look down to the floor, defeated. This wouldn't do, she was giving in to the urge to eat and stuff herself silly, and that would mean a post-binge tantrum when she came back to her senses and you'd both have to redouble your efforts with the workouts. She just couldn't be around addictive junk food, was this another symptom of this blasted disease, you pondered.

Inspiration hits you suddenly with a mallet.

"Irene, do me a favor, will you? Take me outside, and bring the pizzas with you. I've an idea, you'll surely thank me later on, no doubts there." surprisingly, she complied, and with one meaty arm she carried the boxes, while you rested on her shoulder.

"Uh... where are we going?" your cyclopean ride asks, confusion written all over her face. "Please tell me you're not thinking of throwing these into the trash cans outside."

"Nope, want not, waste not, right?" you say with a smirk on your face. After she nods in accordance, you add. "We're taking these to Lupa." Irene actually froze and stopped moving for a few seconds, turning only to look at you, shocked. But after a tense staredown between the two of you, she relented with an explosive sigh.

"Ugh... fine." she mumbled in annoyance. Of all the tenants, it did make sense to deliver the junkfood to the most gluttonous of them all, and the werewolf girl would have something to munch on, for a while at least. You secretly hoped she would become immobile thanks to the virus and the free food, that way she'd be off your back for a very looong time, one less predator to deal with.

After a short walk down the stairs, more like waddle given Irene's predicament, the two of you reach Lupa's door, and she sets the pile of boxes right next to it. Just before ringing the bell though, Irene hesitates. Only after she felt you tapping your foot in her shoulder did she press it. "Ugh... come on, let's go back to my room... before I regret leaving those there." grumbling all the way back, you can't help but roll your eyes.

"At least you're still getting a workout, climbing up and down the staircase." you joked.

On the way back though, you meet someone else, but who?

"Chel?" Both you and Irene ask.

Irene snorted. "Give me some credit. I'm not staying a blimp."

Chel raised a brow at you and you chuckled nervously. "Well, it be a shame to waste the food and Lupa really doesn't care about the nebutori or her weight. Just seemed liked a good idea. A win-win."

Chel jus shook her head. "Well, we won't get anywhere just staying out here in the hall." She wheeled herself around to leave with Irene and you in tow.

You approached one of the doors at the farther end of the hallway, it taking you about roughly thirty minutes to get there with a light jog. It was a hallway to the monsters, a highway to you. You nervously rapped your fist against the bottom of the door, cupping your other hand around your mouth and calling out "Hello? Is anyone home?"

Silence.

You knocked a few more times a bit harder and called out louder."Hey! I'm R.L., your neighbor from downstairs."

After a few more moments, you heard footsteps from within the apartment. Loud, booming steps that shook the ground with each encroaching one. Given the size difference of you and the other residents of the apartment complex, you had felt quakes from their footsteps before. But this one was much different. You had heard that Petra was much, much bigger than any of the other monsters living here. You gulped and hoped that the rumors weren't too true.

With a wide swing the door opened up, a pair of massive orange feet slammed down in front of you, each toe easily the size of a bus and the length of the foot covering a city block or so. You looked up to a massive, curvaceous gargoyle woman looking down at you with a bored look in her eyes, her body clad in a blue police officer's uniform. It seemed you had just interrupted her getting her clothes on, as her cap was haphazardly skewed atop her head and her boots were in her hands."Can I help you?"She asked in a monotone voice.

"Oh uh....hi."You waved up, expecting a reaction from her, but you really couldn't tell considering her chest blocked most of her face so high up."Like I said, I'm R.L....and I've just been wanting to meet my neighbors, that's all. You're Petra, right?"

"Correct."She replied."You're the human from downstairs, right?"She turned around and went back inside her apartment, casually offering for you to come inside as well. You scurried in behind her as she closed the door before sitting down on a couch that rivaled the height of skyscrapers. She truly was big. Much larger than any of the other monsters. Most of the others were around 300-500 feet tall, but you gauged Petra easily around 800 or even a thousand feet tall, leaving her torso and a head taller. She was even intimidating with her scaly, demonic appearance and piercing eyes. Maybe coming up here wasn't the best of ideas.

"I don't know if you're ballsy, or stupid for moving in here. Most humans ignore Horrorville all together."

"Well, I wanted to experience something...different."You replied as you sat down in front of her.

"Heh."She laughed as she put her boots on, nearly blowing you away with the wind generated by her movements."Ballsy is what you are. You know monsters and humans don't get along, it's been like that for ages. Plus, with the whole 'monsters getting gigantic' thing lately, that's really made things edgy. But lucky for both sides, I'm here to keep the peace."She grinned as she proudly flashed a gold policewoman's badge on her chest.

Every one of them had one eccentric quirk or another. You try to bang on the walls of the package but then you remember, you don’t know the harpy who is carrying you back to Direopolis. For all you know she might like to chomp on humans. You begin to wonder who the package is meant for when Olivia reads the name. “Cleopatra Round,” she reads. “Cool. Maybe I’ll get some grub out of this. Patty’s Direopolis’s best cook.” Your eyes poke out of your head. “Did she say cook?” you ask yourself. You’re more nervous than ever. What if whoever gets this package is a predatory monster who likes to cook humans. Now, you begin to think. From the monsters you knew alone, their names were a dead giveaway to their species. Cleopatra Round was most likely a mummy and the only mummy you knew was a human hating tyrant. This was not looking good. Out of curiosity, you decide to look back to see exactly what was in the package. It looked like a cookbook of some kind. You look closely and you’re more horrified than ever. It was a cookbook for sushi. Cleopatra Round was no doubt planning to chop some humans up and serve them with a side of fish and rice. You really hope that Cleopatra Round had very bad eyesight and doesn’t spot you.

After 2 hours, Olivia arrives in Direopolis. You can’t see it but she lands in front of a large and fancy looking house with Egyptian statues outside along with a swimming pool. No doubt it was where Cleopatra Round lived. Olivia knocks on the door and you hear it open before hearing a contralto voice. “Olivia? Pinky said you were in Horrorville for the Terrordale surfing competition.” “Just got back,” says Olivia. “Brought home the silver. Somebody I knew at the post office wanted me to bring this to you, Patty.” “Thanks. I’ll see you at the ball.” “Patty?” you think to yourself. “I guess Cleopatra Round prefers to go by a nickname.” You then gasp as Cleopatra Round starts to walk up to a table to place the package down. From the sounds of her footsteps she particularly large and heavy. You guess she would weigh a few tons if she was human-sized. That was a bad sign. A heavy chef with sushi on the mind.” Then you hear a male voice. “Looks like that cookbook finally came. I can’t believe you’re going through with it, Patty.” “Blame your mother, Wes,” says Patty again. “She was the one who suggested that we add sushi to the menu.”

You then feel tremors. There was another monster in the room who was just as heavy as Patty. The voice that comes from that other monster was very light and bubbly like a teenaged goth girl. “Really? We already serve pizza, burgers, donuts, sundaes, pancakes and panini.” You give a gulp and become more worried. “I thought you’d be supportive, Salli,” says Patty as she takes out a letter opener. “You like your meat raw.” You begin to sweat. Forget Patty. You were more afraid of Salli. Whatever monster she was, she sounded like she liked to eat humans alive. Then you hear a voice that oddly sounds as if you heard it before. “It can’t be helped, Patty. Mom’s always been a huge piscivore. One time she swallowed a submarine by mistake.” You recognized that voice. It was the voice of Corona Poe, a minotaur actress who was well known throughout the monster world. From what you know, Corona is a rather fat copper-furred and black-haired minotaur resembling a bespectacled bison. You remember one of Cadence’s books was made into a movie and Corona was the leading lady. She must either live in Direopolis or she was visiting her in-laws. You then remember that Corona was strictly against the idea of monsters eating humans and breathe a sigh of relief. Then you realize that Corona’s associates might not share her dietary views. Patty has begun to cut through the tape on the box and you hide behind the cookbook hoping that she doesn’t see you and try to eat you. Light enters the box and you see for yourself what kind of monsters were in the room.

Besides Corona there were two of them. The first of them who you guessed was Patty was an enormous pink-skinned and red-haired werehippopotamus with a blue tattoo of a pyramid over one of her eyes. “She’s a werehippo?” you think to yourself. “She’s huge. I’ll bet she’s even bigger than Petra.” Then you turn and see who you guessed was Salli. Salli was a vanilla-skinned loxodon, a monster resembling a humanoid elephant, in her case an Asian elephant. She had long black hair and dark yet colorful eyeliner and lipstick like a goth girl. However, to your surprise, it looks like she has fangs inside the nostrils of her trunk and in her mouth. “Huh? Loxodons don’t have fangs?” Then you realize something strange about these giant women. From the looks of it, they were both wearing costumes. Patty was wearing a skin tight Fox Xanatos costume while Salli from her face makeup and split colored costume with a transparent skirt was dressed as a harlequin. Then you look and notice that there are two humans with these giant ladies. On Patty’s shoulder was a bespectacled and bearded young man dressed like a mummy and on the end of Salli’s trunk was a pale blonde young man dressed as a vampire. Neither looked afraid of either giantess. Then you remembered something. You heard that Corona Poe had three human stepbrothers. Those must’ve been them and Salli and Patty must’ve been their wives. Guess they didn’t eat humans here after all. That was a relief. You look and see that Corona herself was wearing a pink and white outfit with a tiara that clearly meant to make her resemble the Queen of Hearts. Her bright hair was wrapped up in a bun.

You then hear more stomping as another giant woman enters the room. This one is a huge and fat blonde wereboar with brown skin that almost looked like chocolate. However, what was surprising was that this wereboar had leather wings like those of a bat. She was dressed up like a cowgirl with a cow’s skull on the brim of her hat. On the boar woman’s shoulder was a muscular blonde-haired human man who looked younger than the other two and was dressed like a Frankenstein monster. Apparently another of Corona’s brothers. “I can’t wait to go to the big shindig.” says the third brother. “It isn’t a shindig, Norman,” says Wes. “Vienna has invited the town to a charity costume ball.” Pam gives a snort. “I’m not an idiot, Wes. I know it’s a fancy party at Vienna’s place. I just don’t understand why that sister of yours has to go with us.” “Because we agreed to be Corona’s entourage for the night, Pam.” Says Salli. “Not me.” Snorts Pam. Patty gives a scoff. “You were outvoted 2 to 1. Can’t you two get along for just one night?” Pam gives a pout. “What is the charity for anyway.” “To build bigger libraries for our schools to increase literacy.” Says Wes. Pam gives a confused look. “Isn’t that against the law? There’s too much literacy in the world already. That’s why there’s so much garbage in the ocean.” “Not littering, stupid,” says Corona. “Literacy. Something that you obviously would know nothing about.”

Pam gives an angry snort and stomps her foot like an angry child. This sends you up into the air and you fall screaming down until you land in between Corona’s breasts. You grunt and begin to sink down and from the looks of it, Corona didn’t even feel you given the look on her face. She was rolling her eyes at Pam’s actions. “You are so primeval, Pam. What my youngest brother sees in you, I’ll never know.” Salli’s husband lets out a sigh. “Don’t mind them, Allen,” says Salli. “They’re be in a better mood during the festivities.” Patty gives a sigh. “Well, we better get going. The sun just went down. Vienna’s costume ball awaits.” All four giant women stomp out the door with you as an unknown and unwilling tagalong. You struggle but Corona’s body is too thick. All you can do is struggle as all four sisters-in-law make their way to their friend’s place.
1541221.title: Trapped in Direopolis

choices: You tell her you like her music, and she's ecstatic.
You ask her about the night she was angry
You wanna go to the club she DJs at.
155.content:
"Hello?"

You knock on the door that read 'Elle' on the plaque, signifying who lived here. You had seen Elle before, but never spoke to her. It was your first day in Horrorville, and Cadence was showing you around the apartments. Out of the corner of your eye, you spotted something big and feathery shoot electricity from herself, causing a power outage in the whole building for almost an hour. You heard that Elle was simply tired and she had gone off on one of the neighbors. Maybe not all monsters got along like you thought.

"Hm?"

The door opened, revealing a 500ft. tall harpy woman, her feathers bright orange and yellow, her lithe body clad in nothing but cut-off shorts, a raggedy tee, and some headphones around her neck.

"Down here!"You waved up, only for her beaked face to look down at you, amused.

"Oh. Yo little man. You're R.L., right?"

You nod in reply."I just wanted to meet my neighbors."

She cracked a small smile across her beak."Well, come on in, little man. Everybody's welcome to DJ Elle's crib."

You followed behind her, trying to ignore her giant, threatening taloned feet in front of you and her heart-shaped butt swaying above. Her apartment was an utter mess. Trash littered the ground, ranging from soda bottles to pizza boxes and everything in between. The apartment was dark, but lit with neon lights adorning the ceiling, and some electronic music was playing heavily in the background."Yo little man, you want anything?"Elle asked as she walked into her kitchen and to the fridge.

"No, I'm good."You reply as she came back with an energy drink in hand, appropriately labeled 'Monster'. The thunderbird girl crashed down into a comfy beanbag chair, stretching out her long legs until her talons were looming right in front of you.

"So, watcha wanna know, or even do, little man?"She asked as she popped the tab and took a long chug of the sugary beverage.
155.title: Elle, the thunderbird harpy DJ

choices: The two of you listen to her music there
Nefernina knocks on the door, asking for rent
1551.content:
"So..."You began.

"So...?"Elle followed up, taking another gulp of her drink. The can was empty only after two chugs, and she crushed it, throwing it away into the garbage dump that was her floor.

"I've...heard your music before."You finished.

"Have you now?"She giggled, leaning over to look down at you, a glint in her eye. Other than DJ and mix records, Elle was known to release music of her own. She already had an album out, and it was pretty popular with the younger monsters of Horrorville. Cadence had it playing one time, doing her little odd zombie shuffle to the electro-pop music blasting through the air. You had to hand it to the harpy girl, she knew her way around a record table and a synthesizer.

"Yeah,"You went on."The first track was actually a pretty cool lead-up to the rest of the songs. I could hear a similar beat through them, kinda heavy on the bass drop, but just light enough to catch some record spins and hear the synthesizer in the background. Plus, your vocals mixed in well."

Her eyes lit up even more."Finally! Somebody gets my music!"She clapped her wings together happily."You have no idea how much the other monsters 'round here are so...culturally dead with the music. Some of them still listen to the..."She shuddered."...Monster Mash..."She gagged at the song's name in her beak. You had to chuckle at that.

"So..."She picked you up off of the floor, and you found yourself in her feathery palm, looking at her ecstatic face."You're pretty cool for a little dude."

"Thanks."You shrug. You just liked her music, and got this reaction from her? Pretty good considering how you handled the other monsters in this apartment complex.
1551.title: You tell her you like her music

choices: "Head into town and get something to eat."
"Go out and visit some old friends of mine."
1552.content:
"Well, I was kinda wondering why you were so angry before. You know, back on my first day here." You asked her nervously.

"Oh, you wanna know about the blackout? Man, I'm still getting crap from Nefernina about that... It really wasn't anything that spectacular. Just a little conflict of interests. You know Mavis is a singer, right?"

"Yeah, what about her?"

"Well, the day before you moved in, I was gonna have a DJ gig in this new place that was opening up in town. Everything was goin' just fine, but then that banshee bitch came in out of nowhere and decided to upstage me! The manager ended up choosing her singing over my DJ skills, so she got to take over my gig while I ended up with diddly squat! That little bit of static that you saw when you showed up was just my way of getting back at her for moving in on my turf."

"Wow, that must've been rough... So are you to like rivals or something?" You asked curiously.

"Hah, as if! That banshee isn't even worth the dirt off the bottoms of my talons! I don't know what people see in her. Her singing sounds like nails on a chalk board." Elle replied, crossing her feathered arms in frustration.

You just sighed, not knowing what to say. Since you didn't respond, Elle decided to speak up again.

"So, shrimp, is there anything else you want from me, or are you just here to drag up bad memories."

"Oh, I'm really sorry! I didn't mean to bring up anything that you were trying to forget." You said nervously, worrying that you had gotten yourself on Elle's bad side.

Much to your relief, the giantess harpy simply started to laugh.

"Eh, don't worry about it, little guy. It's not like any of it was your fault or anything... Say, I have an idea! Since you don't seem to have anything better to do, how about you and I..."
1552.title: A musical rivalry

15522.content:
You shrug."Sure. What did you have in mind?"

She grinned as wide a grin as a beak could give."There's this awesome restaurant just a few blocks over. It serves everything! Raw fish, buckets of bugs, some nice slime dessert, oh they have this amazing Eyeball-"She paused as she looked down at your disgusted face."Oh yeah....I'm sure they got some human grub down their too."She chuckled.

"...Fine."

"Great!"She got up, holding you in her feathery palm carefully."Let's go!"

Elle walked out the door and out of the apartment, leading you to a view of the rest of Horrorville. It looked exactly as the name would sound signify. Dark grey clouds hung heavily overhead. Tall, giant skyscrapers(relative to the monsters) of gothic deocorum rose into the sky, and monsters of all shapes and sizes walked through the streets. Some gave you odd looks as they passed by, as if the sight of a small human was the most curious thing in the world. For the most part, the monsters who walked by greeted Elle with a wave and a smile.

"Yo Elle!"A Cyclops greeted her with a fist pump.

"Rory!"She fist pumped back just as enthusiastically.

"What you doing with a human?"

"Naw man, this is R.L. He's one cool little dude."

This was about the same with every friend she walked by. Elle was pretty popular. As you neared the restaurant, bright neon letters greeted you. Echidna's Nest was what was emblazoned as the eatery's name. Huh. Fitting name. Echidna was the mother of all monsters, so you guessed it was tribute to her or something. The thunderbird harpy opened the door, and a draconic waiter greeted her."Evening Miss. Table for..."

"Two please."

"Two?"

"I have a little date."She held you up, and the waiter looked at you awkwardly.

"Okay...err...right this way."He motioned, Elle followed, and the two of you were seated in a booth. She sat down and settled you atop the table."Swanky place, eh?"She commented towards you. You had to admit, it was pretty nice. It had a greek fashion to the architecture, but a dark vibe due to the lighting. Overall, perfect place for a monster to eat. Too bad you weren't a monster.
15522.title: "Head into town and get something to eat."

choices: "She absolutely loves humans...a little TOO much."
"She hates humans, she'll kill you if you're spotted!"
155222.content:
The waiter returned a little later, taking your order for drinks. Elle ordered a martini for herself, but as for you...

"I'll just take a water."You say up to the giant dragon-man. He looks at you a little uncertainly."I don't think we have...glasses your size."

You simply shrug in reply."That's cool. You could uh...just bring a normal cup...for you guys...and we can just dip droplets next to me. I'm fine with that."

He looked at you with the same look as before, but shrugged in reply."Fine. I'll be back in a moment with your drinks."

While he was away, you tried to make small-talk with Elle to liven up the mood. Things were going well enough with her, and she seemed to like you a decent amount, enough to go eat out with her. Was this considered a date? Or just a small meal for friends? You had just met her, and already you were doubting anything. With a sigh, you continued."So, where to you usually DJ at?"

She perked up slightly, leaning on her elbows against the top of the table."Down at a club called 'Tombstone Hole. Man, that place is sick!"She cackled a little high-pitched squeal that you expected from a harpy."It's got the most complete set-up for a DJ, from scratch table to disks to effin' strobe lights! And we even got a little smoke machine, and a goblin lady owns it, so we can get some wicked enchantments going on if the partygoers want to!"

She seemed honestly enthusiastic about this sort of stuff. Elle must've really enjoyed what she did.

Before you could really say anything to continue the conversation, the entire restaurant had fallen silent. The clinking of forks and the chatter of the patrons had ceased all together. You looked up at Elle, her eyes wide as she stared out at the entrance. What could be possibly going on that sent a bunch of monsters into awed silence? When you turned your head to look, you found out.

Standing there in the doorway, easily 600ft. tall, was a slender woman, her top human barely covered in a slim tank top, her bottom a coiling snake's tale. She had animalistic features, but you couldn't quite pin everything down about her. One moment, her eyes were piercing, the next, soft. One minute she had fangs, the next, human teeth. Even her hair seemed to change from a soft brown to writhing snakes. All at once, it hit you. Before you was Echidna, the mother of all monsters, the very being that had given birth to every species of monster present.

"Greetings, my children!"She called out to them all in a seductive tone, to which every monster replied "Greetings, mother!"In an almost rapt, cult-like chant.

"How are we doing this evening?"She asked the nearest waiter. He bowed to her before replying."Business is good as usual, mother."He said. Of course, Echidna must've owned the restaurant!

The next thing you knew, Elle's giant feathery hand had grabbed you and hidden you in her lap. You struggled against fingers that were bigger than your whole body, but the thunderbird silence you."Sssh! You don't want Echidna finding you!"
155222.title: The Mother of All Monsters

choices: Elle successfully hides you for the rest of the meal
The waiter tells Echidna that a human was seen with the thunderbird harpy
1552222.content:
"Echidna's hate for humans goes back centuries..."Elle continued to whisper to you, frantically switching between hiding you, smiling nervously, and eying Echidna still speaking with the waiter.

"What...what would she do to me if I was found?"You ask, having given up trying to pry yourself free from Elle's fingers that were nearly thrice your size, letting yourself simply rest in her feathery palm, all you could see was orange and yellow she clutched you so tightly.

"A number of...bad things. She could either serve you up as an entree here...or eat you herself, raw."

You shuddered, glad the harpy cared enough to hide you.

"Or she'd had every monster here stomp on you one by one until you nothing but a flat pancake...and you'd be surprised how many of these dudes here would actually listen to her."

"And you wouldn't?"

"Hey, I got respect for the bitch, seeing as how she made my race and all the other monsters, but she's a power-abuser, using it any way she wants to get whatever she wants, no matter how demeaning it is to her 'children'."

"Sounds...harsh."

"She is."
1552222.title: Ancient Hate

info.brief_description: Can you survive the only human in a building full of giant monsters? Fantasy monsters only
info.description:
(9/21/2016: Under new management. Originally created by RedHurricane)

You are R.L. a rare example of a human living in Horrorville, a city inhabited by the monsters of folklore and legend. To make matters worse all the monsters are giants hundreds of feet tall. Despite this, you've managed to find a place on the second floor at the Monster Arms apartment building. But even there it's a dangerous place. Every apartment houses a monster giantess and they have mixed feelings towards you. Try not to die.

Other Characters
Cadence Deadman- Your roommate, a blue skinned zombie giantess with long hair and two differently colored eyes. The conditions of you living in the apartment was that you share a room with the last new addition. Despite being roommates you don't know much about Cadence since she doesn't speak but let out a few zombie grunts. But considering she's a novelist for a living, she's not as stupid as most zombies. Of course, you're not sure how she thinks about you.

Nefernina-Su-Ancknamun's- Your landlady, a pear shaped mummy girl wrapped in gauze up to her neck. She surprisingly looks no older than you but she's obviously older than she looks. Unfortunately Nefernina hates humans and sees them as pests. It's a wonder she even let you live here. Of course she warned you that there would be consequences should you make any trouble.

Floor 1
Patsy Hardy- Another tenant of the apartment, a giant Siamese cat sith girl. You usually try to avoid her because of her hyperactive nature and your fear of what a cat would do if she caught you. Patsy is a biker who is usually seen with her gang, the Firecats. She also doesn't get along well with Lupa.

Georgia Alexopoulos- Your downstairs neighbor, a humongous hourglass shaped gorgon with cobras for hair. Georgia works as an artisan and craftswoman. You don't have a problem with her, but Georgia has to constantly wear a pair of specially designed sunglasses to keep those petrifying eyes of hers in check.

Shelly Roshi- A giant kappa girl with the shell of a Ridley sea turtle. She's a rather dodgy character who you suspect to be a con artist since she avoids Petra like the plague but you haven't seen enough of her to know.

Chel Sherpa- A yeti girl who is one of the few monsters in the building you have no trouble approaching. She's one of the few sensible creatures and would never intentionally harm you. Usually Chel will try to avoid any of the crazy antics of the rest of the apartment. Unsurprisingly she works as a nurse.

Floor 2

Mavis Blaze- A gigantic hourglass figured banshee with pale skin and dark rings around her eyes, a next door neighbor of yours. She sees herself as an accomplished opera singer but all her music does is give you a headache. Unfortunately for you she's too haughty to listen to you complaining about her.

Alicia Wocky- Another next door neighbor on the opposite side as Mavis and a large yellow green skinned jabberwock. She's somewhat out there and you can barely understand what she's saying. Like Mavis she is musically inclined, but more towards rock than opera. You're pretty sure she's a stoner.

Lupa Howler- Your worst enemy and a giant obese werewolf girl. Lupa works as a tailor/clothes designer but that's not what you're interested in. Lupa is out to get you, in her stomach. She's eaten humans before and she isn't going to quit pursuing you until she's caught you. That's why you don't like leaving the apartment without Cadence.

Izzy Zard- An overweight, bespectacled but beautiful basilisk girl with a long forked tongue. Izzy works as a schoolteacher but she's also very flirty especially towards you and is determined to make you her boyfriend.

3rd Floor- You don't know much about the third floor's opinion towards humans since you rarely go up there, they might be friend or foe.

Bernice Robins- A giant red ifrit (fire genie). Bernice is not very open towards the rest of the apartment but you know she works as a gourmet chef at a monster restaurant and is very single minded when it comes to her work, getting really angry when she's interrupted. You have no idea how she feels towards humans but you don't want to really find out.

Irene Stargazer- A giant purple cyclops girl. Irene is a hypochondriac and is always exercising. She takes health very seriously and even works as a physical instructor. She lives directly above you and Cadence.

Aqua Laguna- A giant apple figured kelpie girl with blue skin. Resembles a scaly anthro horse with gill and a fishes tail but still with hooved feet Aqua is a pacifistic girl who is usually out surfing and generally acts carefree. However you heard a rumor that she used to eat humans. Of course, you don't know if that rumor holds water.

Petra Maza- The tallest girl in the entire apartment complex and an orange skinned hourglass figured gargoyle woman with long white hair. You don't know much about Petra except for the fact she's a cop. You don't think she'd harm you but you can't be sure.

Elle Morningdove- A Native American looking harpy with the wings of a thunderbird and electric powers to match. You've seen Elle getting along with everyone in the apartment (except for Mavis and Nefernina) but you've also heard that she tires easily and is usually asleep. The fact that she works as a night radio DJ might have something to do with it.

New Additions- New monsters added by myself and others.

Bianca- (addition by Spiralwriter) a three headed chimera woman with three personalities. Her left head is a goat's head that's friendly with everyone while her center lion's head is always angry and her snake's head on the right is somewhat of a conspiracy theorist and a paranoid.

Corlette- (addition by Spiralwriter) a ghost girl with long pigtails with pink streaks in her black hair. She's nervous and shy and a bit of a crybaby. She was originally a human who had the extreme misfortune of being eaten by Lupa in a violent manner and is deathly afraid of the wolf girl as a result.

Giselle- A gigantic sphinx. Giselle is very fat and almost spherical in shape due to having no humans being able to answer any of her riddles and as a result she has developed a fear of humans and tries to avoid eating them when she can. Unlike the other monsters, Giselle walks on all fours like an animal.

Arbara- A giant hippie mandrake with the appearance of a humanoid tree. Arbara is against the idea of monsters mistreating or devouring humans and believes that humans can't defend themselves. Unfortunately, this also causes her to see humans as little more than pets.

Zelda- A titanic centaur with the legs of a zebra and long bluish black hair and dark skin. She's usually drunk and not particularly intelligent as a result.

Catalina- (addition by me, name by Spiralwriter) Zelda's roommate and a giant chupacabra woman. She resembles a grayish pink dog woman with spikes growing down her back and long brown hair that appears to have horns. Catalina is the "Felix" of the duo and is always angry with Catalina's messy habits and brainless actions. It would be best to steer clear of her.

Janine- A giant kitsune woman. Janine resembles a human with fox's ears and feet and nine tails. She also has a blue kanji tattoo on the side of her face. It is unknown if she is friendly or evil because she mostly speaks Japanese rather than English.

Koko- One of Janine's neighbors. A green skinned jiang-shi (hopping corpse) giantess. Works as a stunt woman in monster martial arts movies for another jiang-shi but is trying to score higher, with little success.

Renee- A giant and very pear shaped gray skinned hodag woman. Renee has long red hair, horns on her forehead, a dinosaur like tail, a frog like face and large fangs. Renee isn't prejudiced against humans but she despises all men regardless of species. Definitely a bad idea to cross paths with her.

Layla- One of Bianca's neighbors and a 450 foot tall Dullahan, (500) if you count her severed head) who dresses like a medieval knight. Bianca believes that she's an assassin but it's unknown if that's true.

Astrid- Another of Bianca's neighbors and a giant obese crimson skinned manticore with long purplish hair and three sets of razor sharp fangs. Astrid mainly keeps to herself. This is because she is secretly keeping a human mate named Ashley in her apartment (who's gender depends on the storyline).

Amy- A chubby purple skinned gremlin giantess and new addition to the apartment. She's very smart and good with machines but unfortunately is horribly racist against the undead and even treats Nefernina with disrespect.

Elizabeth Williams- (addition by UltimateNeo) A human looking giantess in a trenchcoat and black leather. Before she became a giant, she was Jack the Ripper and Springheel Jack and has the ability to turn her hands into weapons and leap high. Nobody else knows this however. Holds a grudge against Lupa for eating her when she was human and turning her into a wraith like creature.

Selena Brown deCrata- An OC by the 12th Doctor. Selena is an 850ft tall and hourglass shaped were cat covered in black fur with orange hair worn in a ponytail. Mainly wears a black bikini and speaks in a Cajun accent. Selena loves to play pool and will challenge anyone, human or monster. Any human who loses to her has to spend the day in her cleavage.

Aiba Raven Howler- A werewolf with ivory fur and a long, bushy tail. She has short dyed black (it's naturally brown), and red eyes. She has a fairly muscular physique, but since she has Lactose Overload Syndrome, her breasts are gargantuan, easily obscuring her torso and upper legs, and filled to the brim with milk that she can't lactate. Aiba wears black, gothic clothing that shows of as much cleavage as possible and thigh high heeled boots She is a goth through and through. She loves anything that is dark and creepy. It takes a while for her to warm up to anyone. She is rather distant from her family, rarely seeing eye-to-eye with her sister Lupa (since Lupa eats humans and Aiba doesn't) and outright refuses to talk about Persephone. But she can still be a friendly person once you get to know her. Like some women with LOS, Aiba is proud of her breasts. She does hate it when people bring up her namesake though. She is an OC of the 12th Doctor.

Kyoko Hana - An OC of the 12th Doctor, Kyoko is a 1000ft Onryo with chalk white skin, long stringy black hair, and solid black eyes. She has an exaggerated hourglass figure, with MM-Cup breasts, wide hips, and a huge ass. She is covered head to toe with tattoos, all of sexy monster women. They range from BBW's to massively busty, to gorgeous bodybuilders. She wears a skimpy bikini so her tattoos are exposed. Kyoko herself is usually silent. When she does speak, it's limited to one or two words. She is largely emotionless. The majority of her personality are in her tattoos, which are sentient. The tattoos represent aspects of herself, including a very shy bodybuilder, a tomboy with huge boobs, and a very flirty BBW. These tattoos can move freely on her body, are capable of speech, and can even control parts of Kyoko.


Outside of the Apartment

Kimiko "Kim" Drake - An 825ft tall Yuki-Onna who is an OC of the 12th Doctor. Kim has chalk white skin, long, light blue hair, icy blue eyes, and blue lips. Kim's body lacks legs, ending instead in a ghostly tail. Kim is naturally and enormously pear shaped, with a fairly slim upper half/ Kim, being a Yuki-onna, constantly causes it to snow where ever she is. Despite this, she is a warm person, being very friendly. She is a serious meat eater, but refuses to eat humans. She is the landlord of a building with three businesses: a deli, a comic shop, and a salon. She is married to a succubus named Alia. Both have the opposite body shape of the other: Kim has decent breasts but a gargantuan rear, while Alia has a small rear but Lactose Overload Syndrome.

Nicolette Lito Macht - A 1015ft tall were cheetah who is an OC of the 12th Doctor. Nicolette has short, spikey red hair, orange eyes, orange fur with black spots, and a medium tail. She is extremely muscular, but due to her training style, has a gargantuan obese belly. She wears workout gear. Nicolette is a well-known fitness instructor from Germany. She is known for her program that can make woman super muscular, but requires them to have a fat belly. She is loud, demanding, and strict, but she gets results. She wears a ring that protects from all disease, including nebutori.

Tori LeCroix - An OC of the 12th Doctor. Tori is a 1680ft (originally 920ft) rose creature who is friends with Aiba. Tori has forest green skin, blue eyes, and a red rosebud acting as hair. Various other flowers grow out of her body. There are also what appears to be vines on her body. If it weren't for her weight, people would say she resembles Poison Ivy from DC comics. Due to a bizarre strain of nebutori, Tori is impossibly obese. She wears an enormous green bikini made of leaves. Tori may not be the tallest monster (that honor goes to Morgan Wayne) but she is the fattest. A strain of nebutori has turned her into a literal mountain of a woman, weight little over 5 tons (10,000 Ibs). She is extremely proud of this, and determined to get even fatter to maintain her position. Outside of that, she is a friendly person, willing to talk to anyone. She loves comic books.
